Description: Named after Desiderius, a 7th-century Bishop of Cahors, this wine comes from a selection of three parcels, giving intensity and density. The tannins and the complex black fruits and acidity are just setting out, promising a richly structured wine from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2018 Didier Pelvillain Desiderius  (Cahors)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This new brand is making a wide array of wines, and hit on a surprise winner with this single-vineyard Malbec from atop the Cuesta Grade. Dark black-fruit and cocoa aromas are complemented by mushroom and forest-floor scents on the nose. The palate is rich in umami tones, full of black cherry, dried herbs and milk chocolate flavors atop a smooth and creamy tannic profile.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ragtag 2017 Santa Margarita Vineyard Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: This wine comes from a 2.5-acre parcel of old vines. The density is impressive, with swathes of dark tannins and fruits only just beginning to soften. At almost five years the wine is still needs some aging. Wait until 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2018 Château du Cénac Eulalie  (Cahors)

Description: This is a massive and dense wine. Powerful tannins dominate solidly textured black fruits in a wine that shows concentration from the old-vine Malbec. This is a wine to age for several years, so don't drink before 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Cause 2018 La Lande Cavagnac  (Cahors)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling exhibits a pure streak of black currant and blackberry, with purple-flower aromas as well as black soil and rock minerality. There is a solid and chalky tannic tension on the palate, where blackberry-jam flavors are lifted by anise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vincent Vineyards 2018 Family Reserve Malbec (Los Olivos District)

Description: Aromas of savory spices and wild berry fruits introduce a full and ripe palate that's nicely balanced and complex. Finely oaked berry and cassis flavors hold onto their spicy essence, while this integrated Malbec finishes steady and composed. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Altocedro 2018 Reserva Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: Perfumed and ripe with generous black fruits, this powerful wine has dark tannins that are still a dominant element. Aged in wood for 10 months, the wine shows great promise and should be ready from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint Didier Parnac 2019 Latis Grande Réserve  (Cahors)

Description: From the highest plateau of Cahors vineyards, this wine is rich. Dense tannins and rich black-chocolate flavors are intertwined with the wine's solid texture. Power is everywhere, along with the potential for smooth richness. Drink from 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint Didier Parnac 2019 Prieuré de Cénac  (Cahors)

Description: The 50-year-old vines of this vineyard give great richness and density to the wine. Lusciously textured with layers of black plum and berry fruits, with spice from wood aging and considerable potential, the wine should be ready to drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2018 Château du Cénac Grande Réserve  (Cahors)

Description: This is a lush, smoothly textured wine. Fine, elegant tannins support black fruits that are still full of life. The wine has softened from its initial tannins and spice from the new-wood aging. Drink this powerful, beautifully structured wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Prince 2015 Lou Prince  (Cahors)

Description: Ripe, rich and generously textured, this wine has a spicy vanilla character from wood aging. Along with the massive black fruits and opulent structure, that will give the wine density as it ages. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint Didier Parnac 2019 Château du Perry  (Cahors)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a savory and stony take on Malbec, as the crushed gravel aromas wrap around the dark-red fruit and light wood qualities of the nose. There are deeper blackberry and black-plum flavors to the sip, when that rocky quality returns so does the savory, damp wood element.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Assiduous 2018 Black Ridge Vineyard Malbec (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Blueberry, cardamom and floral aromas are distinct on the nose and offer much more complexity than the average value-priced Argentine Malbec. A solidly built palate is balanced by juicy acidity, while this tastes of snappy currant and plum along with desert herbs. A fresh, popping finish lasts a while due to bright acidity. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Made with Organic Grapes Estate Bottled
Name: Inkarri 2019 Made with Organic Grapes Estate Bottled Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: A direct nose is dry and exact, with tight berry aromas that span from red to black in scope. Dry tannins and healthy acidity are to be expected for a 2016, a vintage with much more rain than normal. Herbal plum, currant and wild berry flavors come with a peppery spice backing prior to a medium-length finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Monteviejo 2016 Petite Fleur Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: El Pomar District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich and comforting aromas of black cherry, baked plum, vanilla and nutmeg kick off the nose of this bottling. Soft but apparent tannins frame the baked berry flavors as earthy touches of oregano and iron make for a complex sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: J. Lohr 2018 Shotwell Vineyard Malbec (El Pomar District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dark in the glass, this bottling, which includes 5% each of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, mixes deep black-currant and cherry aromas with mossy wild mints. There's a charred meat and tart, black-skinned fruit character to the palate, with balanced hints of mushroom and plum cordial.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cloak & Dagger 2018 Espionage Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: Jammy berry aromas are herbal and include a slathering of pushy oak, while this feels full and chewy but also a touch saucy and soupy. Blackberry and plum flavors include a generous smear of oak, while this Malbec features mouthcoating tannins and long-lasting oak notes on the finish. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Tahuan Siesta en el Tahuantinsuyu From High Altitude Grapes
Name: Ernesto Catena 2018 Tahuan Siesta en el Tahuantinsuyu From High Altitude Grapes Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe blackberry and prune aromas are slightly desiccated, while this is big on the palate, with voluminous tannins that grab. Plum, black cherry and prune flavors are accented by baking spice notes, while peppery spice rises up on a hefty finish that tastes fully ripe and slightly raisiny. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Septima 2018 Tierra Gualtallary Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Plum, cherry and raspberry aromas are a touch wiry and piquant, but after airing, the nose softens and smooths out. High acidity makes for a bright mouthfeel, with bold plum and raspberry flavors to balance. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2018 Reserva High Altitude Vineyards Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Blackberry and cassis aromas come with herbal hints and lactic oak. A full and chewy palate is cut by fresh acidity, while this tastes saucy and minerally, with dry plum and blackberry flavors that steer clear of being jammy. A touch of raisiny oxidation rises up on a warm finish with herbal notes. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Doña Paula 2018 Selección de Bodega Alluvia Vineyard Malbec (Gualtallary)

Description: Dark plum and blackberry aromas are ripe and inviting, while this organic-grape Malbec is generous and chewy in feel but elevated by well-integrated acidity. Blackberry, black plum and cassis flavors come with savory saucy notes, while this is steady on a finish that's deep and smooth; excellent Malbec for the price.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2020 Cameleon Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: This wine comes from a vineyard that is part of a medieval 17-acre estate. Aged for a year in wood, the wine has great richness, with dense black fruits and generous tannins. The wine promises great things, so wait until 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2018 Château du Cénac Cuvée Prestige  (Cahors)

Description: This Salta Malbec is funky up front, with gamy aromas of earthy black fruits. Bold acidity is a touch blaring, so the palate is lively but also scattered. Said acidity makes for forward plum and berry flavors, while this tastes of coffee and baked berry fruits on a finish that's slightly hot and aggressive; drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: El Esteco 2018 Malbec (Calchaquí Valley)

Description: This ripe, smoky wine has generous tannins that are already hinting at a structured future. The wine's texture and fresh black-currant fruits are all of a piece, promising richness allied to a fresher aspect. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2018 Château du Port Grande Réserve  (Cahors)

Description: Named after the gravel that fills the vineyards of Cahors, partial wood aging gives a wine that is big, bold, structured while also with rich and generous black fruits. It is a fine, ripe wine, fruits and structure in comfortable tandem and likely to age relatively quickly. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint Didier Parnac 2019 Calos Grande Réserve  (Cahors)

Description: Blackberry and dark plum aromas meet a blast of coffee grounds on the nose. This Malbec feels full and lively. Spicy plum and berry flavors come with brambly wildness, while this is focused and under control on a dry finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2018 Famiglia Bianchi Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Pure Malbec, this mature wine still has dusty tannins. But they fit right in with the blackberry fruits of this generous wine. The wine's broad shoulders carry a good structure that is now integrated with the fruit. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Prince 2017 Le Chêne du Prince  (Cahors)

Description: One of a series of limited-quantity, single-variety wines, this Malbec (or Côt to use the local name) is structured, with tannins as well as rich black fruits. At the same time it has a light touch, with acidity and fruitiness already balanced. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Coutinel 2020 Je Suis à Boire Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Description: This wine offers opulent black fruits and dense tannins. Still young, it has good aging potential thanks to the serious structure and concentration. Drink the wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint Didier Parnac 2019 Mission de Picpus Grande Réserve  (Cahors)

Description: Located on the third terrace above the Lot river, this gravel vineyard has produced a structured wine with powerful tannins. Richness also comes from solid black fruits that are developing behind the firm facade. The wine is likely to be ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2018 Château du Port Cuvée Prestige  (Cahors)

Description: Ripe blackberry and cassis aromas are brightened by a note of red plum, while this solidly built and well-balanced Malbec is enlivened by just the right amount of acidity. Raspberry, plum and black currant flavors show a slight touch of minty green, while this remains solid and in form over a medium-long finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2019 Reserve Made with Organic Grapes Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Catchy aromas of lavender, desert herbs, cardamom and minty berry fruits are fresh and indicative of a high-altitude Malbec. The palate is round and ever so slightly choppy, with medium-level concentration and weight. Currant, wild berry and spiced plum flavors are lightly oaky, while this is steady and smooth on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Doña Paula 2019 Estate High Altitude Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Located on the third terrace above the Lot river, this gravel vineyard has produced a structured wine with powerful tannins. Richness also comes from solid black fruits that are developing behind the firm facade. The wine is likely to be ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2018 Château du Port Cuvée Prestige  (Cahors)

Description: Plum and berry aromas are accented by a whiff of desert brush and hefty lemony oak. A powerfully built palate has a resiny feel to it, while oaky blackberry flavors show a strong barrel influence backed by herbal hints and smacking tannins. This is excellent for an inaugural wine, with room to improve in subsequent years.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Finca Mangato Alto de las Piedras
Name: Las Estelas 2017 Finca Mangato Alto de las Piedras Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: This rich wine is seriously structured, with firm tannins still in place. They surround potentially rich and luscious blackberry fruits that are beginning to shine. Drink the wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2018 Domaine du Théron Cuvée Prestige  (Cahors)

Description: Situated at Vire-sur-Lot, this old vineyard has produced a dense wine, rich in black-currant and berry fruits and shaped by wood aging and acidity. Drink this ripe wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Labastide Haute 2019 Malbec  (Cahors)

Description: Dark and saturated in color, this tasty organic Malbec opens with reduced aromas of blackberry and a touch of rubber that clears up with airing. A meaty and full palate is a slightly gripping and warm, while likable blackberry and black plum flavors finish with power.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2020 Virgen Organic Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Made without wood aging and with attractive black fruits amid the solid tannins, this wine should be drunk relatively young. The berry fruits and spice are appealing and full bodied. It will be ready from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Cause 2018 Terre de Malbec  (Cahors)

Description: Just approaching maturity, this wine with luscious black fruits is dense and solid. The tannins have now lost their firmness and opened into the rich black fruits. The wine, with its great freshness, is now ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haute-Borie 2016 Tradition  (Cahors)

Description: Plum and berry aromas are bold and show a touch of fresh asphalt on the nose. This value-priced Malbec feels lively and juicy, with black plum, blackberry and saucy flavors. Hints of licorice and toast appear on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Corbeau Wines 2019 Little Mad Bird Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Edgy berry aromas come with a floral hint and a note of cinnamon. For a value-level Malbec, this offers a lot of fruit and stuffing along with choppy tannins. Plum and black cherry flavors are slightly gamy, while this maintains energy on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Fest 2020 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: In its name, this wine emphasizes the Cahors vineyard terraces above the River Lot. It's lightly tannic, with blackberry fruits and acidity. With a refreshing aftertaste, the wine is ready now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Rigal 2019 Les Terrasses  (Cahors)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Bold, saturated black-fruit flavors mingle beautifully with light clove, cinnamon and a whiff of pine forest in this nicely layered and complex wine. Velvety, fine-grained tannins give it a mouthfilling heft and extend the tasty finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cinnabar 2017 Malbec (Lake County)

Description: A straight Malbec in New Zealand is a fairly rare sighting, and even rarer is one with some bottle age. This wine is in a good place. The oak-driven mocha-and-toasted spice is a little prominent, but the fresh red and black berry fruit, mint and tobacco leaf characters hold their own. In the mouth, tannins are chalky and chunky, but there's a lovely crunch of acidity, and once again the tangy fruit is not lost. There's some flash and muscle here, but there's also plenty of cool climate charm. Drink now with protein and decanter at hand or until 2030.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Decibel 2016 Testify Malbec (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Frankly, it'd be nice to see more non-Pinot New Zealand reds made like this: fresh, light-to-medium bodied, early drinking vin de table wines sans all the oak and polish. This highly approachable Malbec weaves fresh cherries, cranberries and raspberries together with notes of fresh mint, tree sap and tobacco leaf. The palate is as fresh as the nose suggests, with lithe, granular tannins and crunchy fruit. Drink slightly chilled with a weeknight roast or platter of cured meats.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Decibel 2019 Giunta Nouveau Malbec (New Zealand)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is all varietal, with 61% coming from Malbec heartland Gamache Vineyard and the rest from Lawrence. Spice, red plum and gummy aromas lead to flavors that bring depth, texture and structure. It ramps up the longer it is open.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Category 5 2017 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a medium- to full-bodied Malbec that embodies the power and freshness of Gimblett Gravels in Hawkes Bay. Cranberry and cherry tart aromas mingle with vanillin oak and bundles of earthy spices like cumin, bay, cloves and mint. It's less harmonious on the palate, with elevated acidity amid chalky, powerful-yet-fine tannins and crunchy red and black berry flavors throughout. Drink now with a roast lamb or grilled mushrooms, or cellar until 2027.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Decibel 2017 Gimblett Gravels Malbec (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas and flavors of orange and tangerine essence are followed by notes of red plum, flower and cranberry. It's all an interesting mix, equal parts intrigue and delivery.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Structure 2018 Foundation Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A superdeep color leads to cedar and freshly sawn oak aromas, as well as flavors drenched in tasty baking spices and dark chocolate in this rowdy, full-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Miraflores 2017 Estate Malbec (El Dorado)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas aren't ready to show themselves, with light notes of spice, orange peel and dill. The plum and orange rind flavors meanwhile bring vitality and length. One wants more aromatically, but the palate delivers a lot of enjoyment.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Liberty Lake 2018 Scooteney Flats Vineyard Malbec (Red Mountain)

Description: This is in an odd place at the moment, but if the 2017 is anything to by, it will hopefully find its way with another year in the bottle. There's a burnt rubber note on the nose, but there's also plenty of more appealing aromas like fresh mint, red and black berries, earthy spices and a dusty oak character. The palate is equally austere. Tannins are big and chewy, lacking a generosity of fruit to temper them. Give this at least a year to unravel. Drink 2022–2028.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Decibel 2018 Gimblett Gravels Malbec (Hawke's Bay)

Description: With soft red fruit at its core, this ripe wine is moderate in structure and acidity, with a nuanced integration of oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vine Cliff 2017 Malbec (Oakville)

Description: Earthy, veggie aromas and peppery, herbal flavors make this wine an acquired taste for those who want to drink organic and consume no added sulfites.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2019 Organic Malbec (Mendocino)

Description: The top wine of this estate, this was bottled without added sulfur and is developing well. It has great richness as well as density. Blackberry fruitiness shines through dry core, promising an exciting future. The wine will be ready from 2024. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Cèdre 2018 Le Cèdre Extra Libre  (Cahors)

Description: A selection of the best parcels of this estate, this is a perfumed, wood-aged wine. Rich in mature tannins while the texture remains dense and concentrated, the wine has great heft and structure. Now just mature, it still offers impressive life and fruit. Drink now or wait until at least 2022. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Chambert 2015 Grand Vin  (Cahors)

Description: Even after five years, some dry tannins sustain the black Malbec fruits. But the balance is there with rich damson and black-plum flavors, showing structure with fruit. It is just ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2015 Clos Triguedina Probus  (Cahors)

Description: An opaque color and aromas of crisply spiced blackberry and smoke form the opening on this fine Malbec from Gualtallary in the Uco Valley. A concentrated palate is anchored by grabby tannins that should resolve with more bottle age. Toasty blackberry and cassis flavors are backed by chocolaty notes, while this feels smooth and doesn't grind on the finish. Enjoy through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: 4 Gatos Locos 2018 Malbec (Gualtallary)

Description: Produced from old vines, this wine is just moving towards maturity. Perfumed from wood aging, rich in structure that is softening into the blackberry fruits, the wine is impressively shaped with its tannins and vibrant aftertaste. Drink from 2022. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Chambert 2016  Cahors

Description: A dark color and rich aromas of blackberry, graphite, coconutty oak, raisin and saddle leather open this full-bodied Malbec with dry tannins. Baked blackberry, prune, chocolate and herbal flavors cover the full spectrum of varietal tastes, while this remains bold and stout on a heavy finish. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Kaiken 2017 Mai The First Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This elegant wine with ripe, perfumed tannins and rich structure is produced by Cathy and Daniel Fournié. The texture, smooth wood-aging character and generous black-plum-skin flavors all promise plenty of aging. Drink this wine from 2024. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2018 Prestige  (Cahors)

Description: Aging in amphoras has expanded the richness and ripe fruits of this wine. It has also given it structure and density, which will allow it to age well. This balanced, ripe wine is shot through with acidity. Drink from 2022. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2017 K-2  (Cahors)

Description: Mild herbal and gamy notes add character to meaty blackberry and cassis aromas, while this Malbec from an excellent vintage feels full, smooth and chewy. Fully ripe and dense blackberry and chocolate flavors finish warm and steady, with concentration and balance. Enjoy now through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Single Vineyard Finca Agrelo Organic Vineyard
Name: Argento 2018 Single Vineyard Finca Agrelo Organic Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe, earthy black fruit aromas are balsamic and suggest boozy spice cake. Following the nose, this Malbec from a very good vintage is jammy in feel, with thorough ripeness. Prune, raisin, molasses and cassis flavors wrap up quickly on a slightly hot finish. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Furlotti 2013 Finca Adalgisa Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aged entirely in clay amphora, this wine has tannic texture that gives it a dry core. Rich, generous black fruits pulse with vibrancy and minerality from the clay and ironstone soil. Drink this wine now, but it could well age further.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Capelanel 2015 Cuvée Titouan  (Cahors)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Suave aromas of black cherry, creamy caramel, vanilla and dark red flowers converge on the nose of this bottling. Thick yet elegant tannins frame the sip, where Morello cherry, baked boysenberry and baking spice flavors make for a satisfyingly rich expression.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Opaque 2018 Malbec (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Early aromas of latex and Band-Aid yield to ripe plum and cassis, while this parcel-specific Malbec is drawing and scratchy in feel. Herbal blackberry, plum and cassis flavors are short on depth and complexity, while this tastes mildly oaky on a finish with dry, rubbing tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2017 Parcel N°10W Los Cerezos Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Early aromas of latex and Band-Aid yield to ripe plum and cassis, while this parcel-specific Malbec is drawing and scratchy in feel. Herbal blackberry, plum and cassis flavors are short on depth and complexity, while this tastes mildly oaky on a finish with dry, rubbing tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2017 Parcel N°10W Los Cerezos Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Named after the Roman emperor who allowed vines to be planted in Cahors, this ripe wine is perfumed with wood spice. Black fruits are still firmly controlled by tannins, suggesting further aging. Drink this wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2017 Clos Triguedina Probus  (Cahors)

Description: A huge and sappy nose smells smoky and creamy, with soupy dark-berry aromas along with heat and green notes. Like the bouquet, this is full and thick in feel. Saturated blackberry, chocolate, fig and raisin flavors are hot and intense, while the structure of this massive Malbec is heavy but in no way elegant. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Rolland 2011 Yacochuya Malbec (Cafayate)

Description: Reedy berry aromas are earthy and herbal, with a touch of grassy green. A flush and lively palate is full and edgy, while this Malbec tastes of oak, berry fruits, herbs and peppery spice. Mint and herbal spice flavors are notable on a finish where the fruit evaporates almost immediately. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca La Anita 2017 Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: From a single vineyard of 50-year-old Malbec, this wine has the potential to be rich and opulent as it ages. Big tannins and black-fruit flavors make for a powerful, smoothly textured wine. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Nozières 2016 L'Elegance  (Cahors)

Description: Partially aged in amphora, this wine comes from an unusual clay and ironstone vineyard, giving structure and mineral texture to the plummy character. With tannins now fully cushioned by the mature black fruits, the wine has great density and is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Capelanel 2014 Amphût  (Cahors)

Description: Earthy black fruit aromas include notes of sun-dried prune and cinnamon. This Patagonian Malbec is ripe and full but popping with cool-climate acidity. Blackberry and peppercorn flavors finish smooth but firm enough to avoid any semblance of softness.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Wapisa 2018 Malbec (Río Negro Valley)

Description: Partially aged in amphora, this wine comes from an unusual clay and ironstone vineyard, giving structure and mineral texture to the plummy character. With tannins now fully cushioned by the mature black fruits, the wine has great density and is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Capelanel 2014 Amphût  (Cahors)

Description: From a single vineyard of 50-year-old Malbec, this wine has the potential to be rich and opulent as it ages. Big tannins and black-fruit flavors make for a powerful, smoothly textured wine. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Nozières 2016 L'Elegance  (Cahors)

Description: An opaque dark-purple color and aromas of cinnamon, graphite and jammy blackberry announce a palate that's medium in intensity. Flavors of light oak, baking spice and blackberry are familiar for Argentina, while this magnum of Malbec shows smooth tannins and medium depth on the finish. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luca 2018 Historia de Familia Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Black cherry and blackberry aromas include a hint of vanilla, while this is anchored by juicy acidity. Flavors of oaky vanilla, plum and blackberry are convincing but nothing unique for Uco Valley Malbec, while this is easygoing on the finish. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Polo 2017 Herencia la Palabra Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Baked blackberry and plum aromas include notes of coffee and raisin on the nose. Spiky acidity lends texture to the medium-depth palate, while this tastes of blackberry and cassis before transitioning to chocolate and toast on the finish. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Kaiken 2018 Ultra Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Spicy blackberry and dark plum aromas are balsamic and earthy, with a hint of cinnamon. A lively palate pops with acidity before settling, while this tastes of earthy berry fruits, prune and salt. Dry tannins keep this focused and on path through the finish. For a value-priced Malbec, this shows complexity and a higher-than-normal level of quality.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mendoza Vineyards 2018 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Muscular but composed black fruit aromas stop short of being overripe. A full yet balanced palate is, much like the nose on this Malbec, big but in shape. Blackberry, black plum and prune flavors are ripe and appealing, while a sturdy finish doesn't change the script.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Monteviejo 2018 Festivo Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Deep and generous black-cherry flavors are wrapped in silky tannins in this nicely concentrated and polished wine. It boasts a soothing mouthfeel, with touches of clove and cardamom that add to its appeal.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Saracina 2018 Skid Row Malbec (Mendocino County)

Description: This rich, wood-aged wine is dense with tannins and powerful black fruits, both of which are still very young. The structure and concentration promise a full, concentrated future. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos d'Audhuy 2018  Cahors

Description: Aged for 24 months in large barrels, this is now a smoothly textured wine. Its maturity is just right, still with plenty of black fruits as well as developing secondary flavors. This ripe, balanced wine is ready to drink. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2014 K-Lys  (Cahors)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Dark plum, heavy chai spice and also crisper red fruits pop on the nose of this agile bottling. The palate is crisp and refreshing, offering candied cherry and red currant as well as baking spice and a searing acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hungry Hawk 2017 Estate Reserve Malbec (San Diego County)

Description: Rich, mature aromas of chocolate, caramel, baking spice, blackberry and cassis feed a clamping palate with wiry tartaric acidity. At 15.5% abv, this is an old-school more-is-more Malbec that tastes of baked plum, blackberry, vanilla and chocolate. Staunch acidity stands out on a thick finish dominated by blackened toast and coffee flavors. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Puro Uno 2011 Gran Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of dried earth, baking spice, wild berry and smoky plum are expansive on the nose, while it feels medium in weight on the palate. Baked black plum, oak spice and tomato flavors bring all the elements of high-altitude grapes into play. The finish is tight and dry, with berry flavors aided by oak spice and pepper.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Anko 2018 Flor de Cardón Malbec (Salta)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cocoa and caramel scents meet with baked black cherry, licorice, oak and cola ice cream floats on the nose of this bottling. It's thick and hearty on the palate, where bold smoke, baking-spice and rich red-fruit flavors align.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McClain Cellars 2018 Covent Garden Reserve Malbec (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Spicy blackberry, cola and cool earth aromas set up a hefty palate with midlevel acidity and rubbing tannins. Ripe, lightly baked blackberry and dark plum flavors finish steady on a full and jammy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Salentein 2018 Reserve Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a well-balanced, moderately tannic wine with plenty of juicy cherry and raspberry flavors under a light coating of cinnamon and nutmeg aromas. It's medium to full bodied and has a touch of red pepper to add extra spice.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2018 Malbec (Livermore Valley)

Description: Initially this Malbec smells reduced and rubbery, like black olive and pavement mixed with blackberry and prune. A smacking palate softens with time and airing to show buttery thickness, while this tastes of ripe black fruits with a hint of raisin. A chunky, jammy finish conveys all of the wine's 15% abv.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2018 Gran Made with Organic Grapes Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Floral aromas of violets and rose petals blend with berry fruits and mild grassy notes in this Malbec. It's soft in feel, with flavors of blueberry, blackberry and cassis that lead to a smooth finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild Lafite and Nicolas Catena 2018 Aruma Malbec (Mendoza)
Winery: Domaines Barons de Rothschild Lafite and Nicolas Catena

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are reserved, with notes of plum and dried herbs. Plump but still light, appealing fruit flavors follow, dipping in the middle. Pleasingly bright acidity accent it.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Mercer 2017 Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Berry and plum aromas are generous, jammy and lightly spiced and bring a wild animal note into play. A full and flush mouthfeel supports spicy plum, currant and raspberry flavors. On the finish, dry spice notes and a composed texture are positives.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Zolo 2019 Estate Grown and Bottled Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Gritty blackberry aromas are peppery and spicy, while lively acidity drives a full and piercing palate. Spicy plum and blackberry flavors show a hint of backside prune, while this tastes of oak spice, pepper and black fruits on a solid finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Kaiken 2018 Selección Especial Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe blackberry-jam aromas meet with wild herbs of fennel and tarragon on the nose of this bottling, which includes 5% Petite Sirah. There is a wild-chaparral kick to the sip, which is thick with lush blackberry and black-cherry flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Byron Blatty 2018 Pragmatic Malbec (Los Angeles County)

Description: Aging in old barrels has polished the mature black fruits of this wine. While the wine's age gives it a leathery texture, ripe black fruits still come through. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Capelanel 2014 Cuvée Pech Petit  (Cahors)

Description: Earthy berry and plum aromas lack expression regardless of how much air this gets. Saucy acidity sits atop the palate, which tastes of herbal tomato, red plum, currant and raw oak. Tomatoey acidity returns on a finish that's slightly green as well as raisiny tasting. Something isn't quite clicking with this high-end Malbec from Gualtallary in Tupungato.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2017 Parcel N°1E El Espinillo Malbec (Gualtallary)

Description: Blueberry and cool herbal aromas set up a flush palate balanced by bright acidity. Dark plum and spicy berry flavors are standard but tasty and well presented. A finish with herbal and peppery spice notes closes out this solid Malbec.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Black Cabra 2019 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Blackberry and black plum aromas are a touch fiery and gritty in front of a full-bodied palate with chunky weight and moderate acidity. Shallow but bold dark berry and black plum flavors finish short but solid.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Profesión 2018 Sommelier Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Aged in tanks, this pure Malbec wine shows structured fruits, crisp acidity and a dry core. Fruitiness is the key to its immediate attractiveness, but it will take a short while more to be ready. Wait until late 2021. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2019 K-Or  (Cahors)

Description: Foxy wild berry aromas are jumpy in front of a juicy mouthfeel that's a bit hot and rough. Mixed black fruit flavors feature a peppery, slightly charred backing. Said peppery spice drives an edgy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ceibo 2019 Estate Bottled Sustainably Farmed Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Asphalt aromas are at the fore and eventually give way to green pepper, orange essence, exotic spice and loose gravel. Reserved, bunched up fruit flavors follow. The tannins give a grip, and the acidity is bright. It's not clear where it's all going.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Huston 2018 Malbec

Description: This wine is about rich blackberry flavors, lots of spice and a few tannins. It has been made in an approachable style, ready to drink young so as to enjoy the fruity side of Malbec. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Capelanel 2019 Cuvée Petitou  (Cahors)

Description: Produced from young vines, this is a softly textured, succulent and fruity wine. It is all blackberry flavors, ripe tannins and attractive acidity. This wine is ready to drink. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Cèdre 2019 Juveniles  (Cahors)

Description: Leafy berry aromas are mulchy and earthy at first, then gritty like asphalt. A plump palate is on the soft and flat side, with low to medium acidity. Blackberry and blueberry flavors slip away on a full and chunky finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tacho 2018 Reserva Hand-Picked Estate Vineyards Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Now mature, this gently textured wine is soft but has plenty of vibrant, juicy fruits. Freshness and acidity shine through the texture, producing balance and a wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Capelanel 2016 La Rangée du Curé  (Cahors)

Description: This full, ripe and fruity wine brings out vibrant black fruits and soft tannins. The wine has been made to drink young and fresh, with generous textures and an open aftertaste. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos d'Audhuy 2019 Le Pommier Gourmand  (Cahors)

Description: Dark-berry aromas are nonspecific and slightly rustic and stewed. A tight palate is cemented by crisp acidity and dry tannins. Saucy black plum and berry flavors don't evolve on a tannic finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Manos Negras 2019 Atrevida Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Wiry berry and plum aromas are punchy and raw, while this feels full but tough. Skimmed berry flavors are backed by dry tannins that leave a scratchy feeling on the finish of this aggressive Malbec.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2019 Made with Organic Grapes Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Spicy berry aromas are a touch jammy and herbal, with notes of animal and wild brush. A pulpy mouthfeel is on the soft side, while this tastes of dark plum and berry fruits prior to a solid but plodding finish.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Gaucho Select Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled
Name: Zolo 2019 Gaucho Select Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Leafy currant and raspberry aromas are lightly green and floral. On the palate, this hits with hard tannins. Herbal and red berry flavors turn spicy and peppery, while this Malbec finishes with mild green hints.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Wellsley Farms 2019 Gran Seleccion Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This wine is soft and fruity, with only the lightest tannic touch. It is juicy, fresh with red fruits and good acidity. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos d'Audhuy 2019 Les Polissons  (Cahors)

Description: Earthy berry aromas clean up with airing, while this is rather lean and angular in feel. Tart plum and currant flavors finish bright and a bit salty, with crisp lasting acidity maintaining freshness.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alta Vista 2019 Vive Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dusty plum and berry aromas are generic and easygoing. A plump and jammy palate is chunky and a bit scratchy, while this everyday Malbec tastes of saucy plum and berry fruits prior to a finish that leaves lighter raspberry and red plum notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Norton 2019 1895 Colección Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Herbal, plum and berry aromas lead to a medium-bodied palate that's more fleshy and pulpy than defined. Grapy plum and berry flavors come with a slight herbal green hint as well as a dash of cumin. On the finish, this shows controlled rawness and burn.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mi Terruño 2019 Uvas Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A gritty nose smells more damp and mossy than bright and fruity. On the palate, this Malbec feels flat, hard and dense. Berry flavors take on a minty tinge before turning raisiny, while a simple finish with mild burn wraps this up.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mendoza Vineyards 2019 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A yeasty veil covers pinched aromas of citrus, cumin and sweat. The palate on this Malbec rosé is lightly citric, while mild orange and melon flavors don't rise above basic. Skins-based bitterness surfaces on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Rutini 2019 Destino Rosé de Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Black fruit aromas come with notes of road tar and chocolaty oak. A creamy mouthfeel is sticky, while this tastes of herbal dark-berry fruits topped with milk chocolate.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alamos 2019 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of black olive, rubber, iodine and earthy berry fruits feed into a linear and narrow palate with sharp acidity and not much depth. Tart plum and currant flavors are salty, while this is punchy and edgy on a finish that tastes mildly green.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Doña Paula 2019 Los Cardos Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dark-berry aromas come with hints of cinnamon and hand soap. The palate is full and grabby due to gravelly tannins. Medicinal plum and currant flavors run a bit green, while dry residual tannins make for a choppy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Skroo One 2019 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Stewy berry aromas are green and grassy, while this is raw, saucy and sharp on the palate. Shallow red plum and tart berry flavors are equally green, while that dominating herbal character carries over to a finish with no richness.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tenorio 2019 Single Vineyard Reserva Malbec (La Rioja)

Description: Dark ruby in color, this wine is flat and slightly medicinal and not terribly pleasing on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Essere Franco 2019 Rosé of Malbec (Yountville)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Varietal Malbec is a rarity in the valley. This one is single block, native fermented and saw only 20% new oak. The aromas take some time to get going, but once they do, they bring notes of purple flower, blue fruit and crushed rock. Lipsmacking fruit flavors follow, showing intensity and vibrancy as well as exquisite balance and length. It's shockingly good, a new style of higher altitude Malbec for Washington with all the goodness that brings. Decant if drinking in the near term. Best after 2024.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Devison 2018 Southwind Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly woven aromas of dark plum and dark cherry are sprinkled with dried herbs and pepper spice on the nose of this bottling. Polished tannins frame baked black fruits and dark violet tones, with flavors of cardamom cream and sandalwood leading into an acid-washed finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brecon Estate 2018 Malbec (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-cherry and blackberry-jam aromas meet with dark mint, light leather and smoothed-out oak tones on the nose of this bottling. That suave element carries to the palate, where baked cherry, light oak and a touch of mint flavorings make for a very enjoyable sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hearst Ranch 2018 Babicora Malbec (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a treat! 100% varietal, all in magnum. Plentiful aromas of plum and dried herb lead to elegant, streamlined plum flavors. It brings freshness, vibrancy and intensity, always remaining light on its feet.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kerloo 2018 Red Willow Vineyard Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: 100% varietal, dried herb, satsuma, graphite and plum aromas are followed by lighter styled plum, blue fruit and blood orange flavors. It brings plenty of purity and elegance.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kerloo 2018 Stone Tree Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark roasted coffee bean aromas are out front, followed by notes of dark chocolate and spice. The spice and dark fruit flavors are plump, soft and generous. The fruit brings a compelling sense of freshness.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Fielding Hills 2017 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas draw you in, with notes of plum, huckleberry and whole satsuma. Plush, plump red and blue fruit flavors follow. Coffee notes linger on the finish. It's much of what there is to love about the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Basel Cellars 2017 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: It's often forgotten that Malbec was once a major grape in the region. Climate change has brought increased interest in this variety, as reflected in this dark-colored wine. Big, bold tannins and ripe berry flavors give both a firm structure and rich, almost sweet, fruitiness. The wine needs time, so drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Fleur Haut Gaussens 2018 La Viminière Malbec  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Description: Aromas of raspberry, cedar and leather come together on the nose. The palate offers more of the same in raspberry and cherry notes shining brightly with tart acidity matched by crushed velvet tannins. The finish lingers, carrying ripe raspberry and sage.                      Fiona Adams
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Limited Release Malbec (Virginia)

Description: Blackberry aromas includes notes of vanilla, fresh herbs and damp earth. This Malbec is concentrated and nicely balanced, with blackberry, herbs, black plum and spice notes. Oaky residual flavors drive a finish that's more herbal than fruity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Montes 2018 Alpha Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a solid, varietally-true expression, with brambly berry fruit and plenty of herbal and savory components. Thistle and rosemary, thyme and more are in play, along with substantial tannins. Extended aging in 40% new barrels has added a wash of vanilla as it fades.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Naumes 2017 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of mentholated tobacco, thyme and moss sit above a rich dark-fruit core. The medium-bodied palate is plush and juicy in black berry tones, while polished tannins and bright acidity play in the background.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lenz 2015 Estate Selection Unfined Unfiltered Malbec (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Black cherry, raspberry and creosote make for an unusual but not unpleasant combination on the nose. Bright and juicy on the palate, it's a cornucopia of berry fruits bolstered by tart plum-skin acidity. Oak and leather fused with dusty tannins play a supportive roll and gain prominence through the long, tingling finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Bogati 2018 Malbec (America)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of mortared fresh parsley and other green herbs are out front. Notes of purple fruit and orange rind follow. the palate is light and graceful, with a lightly smoky finish. It's quite green but brings a sense of freshness.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Callan 2017 Boushey Vineyards Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Starting off with a warm, inviting nose of cinnamon, black tea and crushed black pepper, this delves into juicy blackberry flavors on the medium-bodied palate. Pulsing acidity holds court, making this tasty, lively and fresh, but the finish comes a bit too soon.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bedell 2018 Malbec (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of black currant, pine resin and violet extract show on the nose of this bottling. Dark, extracted berry flavors and more purple-flower flavors are framed by angular tannins on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2018 Malbec (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A fresh, lively nose of pomegranate, juiced blueberry and red flowers gives this an easy, crushable vibe. It's light and juicy on the palate, with enough structure to hold it all together. Enjoy with a slight chill and glug.                      Alexander Peartree
Designation: Small Batch Series Corey Creek Vineyard
Name: Bedell 2019 Small Batch Series Corey Creek Vineyard Malbec (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Herbal black-fruit aromas are gamy and suggest a field with various aromatic plants. A fleshy, pulpy palate holds herbal berry flavors, superficial oak and saline notes. The finish on this Malbec is grabby and ever so slightly green.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Montes 2018 Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Loamy soil, mahogany and baked red-cherry aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is sticky in tannins and very woody in flavors, with cedar chip and pine resin as well as dried fruit elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Martin Ranch 2017 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Malbec (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: Stalky berry aromas share the nose with animal notes and hot summer field scents. A punchy palate is edgy and bright, while medicinal berry, cherry and plum flavors include a smear of surface-level oak.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Santa Rita 2018 120 Reserva Especial Malbec (Central Valley)

Description: The nose delivers scents of blueberry, blackberry and violet, with hints of green peppercorn and oak. Tart red berry and green herb flavors arise alongside sharp acidity on the palate, while the tannins come off as velvety. Raspberry and sour cherry linger alongside raw oak on the finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Horton 2016 Malbec (Virginia)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Dark purple and scented with vanilla and tobacco, this bears little in the way of a varietal signature. There's a touch of blueberry but it's quickly overtaken with the non-fruit components and rolls into a short, very tannic and astringent finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Schmidt 2017 Reserve Malbec (Applegate Valley)

Description: This is the top wine from a partnership between California consultant Paul Hobbs and the Vigouroux family of Cahors. It is a splendidly rich wine, with licorice, spice and swathes of powerful black fruits. There is an astonishing amount of freshness as well, with its acidity and black currant flavors balancing the wine's density. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Paul Hobbs & Bertrand Gabriel Vigouroux 2015 Crocus La Roche Mère  (Cahors)

Description: Selections from the estate's top parcels and aging in new wood for two years have produced an immensely rich wine. Polished and spicy, the wine has serious tannins as well as layers of black fruits. The wine is just there, and it is impressively ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vincens 2016 Graves de Paul  (Cahors)

Description: Produced from vines on chalk soil, the wine is one of three produced by California-based consultant Paul Hobbs in partnership with the Vigouroux family in Cahors. Textured with strong touches of minerality as well as tannins, the wine has a richly juicy character as well as powerful black fruits. Concentration and wood aging give the wine its potential, which is not yet realized. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Paul Hobbs & Bertrand Gabriel Vigouroux 2015 Crocus Le Calcifère  (Cahors)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Wonderful aromas of balsam and cedar give way to warm, broad, grilled plum and cooked blueberries in this full-bodied wine. Soft tannins give an especially velvety texture that pulls the tempting flavors through a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cuda Ridge 2017 Reserve Malbec (Livermore Valley)

Description: This pure Malbec wine is solid, dark with tannins and blueberry fruits. It is full and rich, dense with ripeness and serious concentration. With its richness still coalescing, the wine could age further, so drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vincens 2017 Origine  (Cahors)

Description: Still totally young, this dense, structured and tannic wine shows strong wood aging flavors. Licorice and bitter chocolate emphasize the wine's youth and fine future. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vincens 2018 Origine  (Cahors)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense aromas of blackberry, ham, coffee and a hint of leather show on the brooding nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with earthy and savory flavors of bloody meats and tobacco, as sandy tannins frame the dark fruit flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Peachy Canyon 2018 Ms Behave Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: Of course, this wine is still young, but it has great potential. Rich, packed with black fruits and with a smoky background, the wine has weight, density and a fine future with its black plum skin and acidity well in balance. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lagrézette 2017 Cuvée Marguerite Massaut  (Cahors)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This absolutely mouthfilling and delicious wine packs extra-ripe black-cherry and blackberry flavors into a firmly tannic but and high-octane structure. The intense fruit concentration is a treat to experience now, but best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mount Saint Joseph Wines 2017 Malbec (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All of the fruit for this 100% varietal wine comes from Solaksen Vineyard on the Royal Slope. Aged in second-fill and neutral oak, the aromas are brooding initially, with notes of cherry, plum, orange oil and dried herb, showing a sense of purity. The flavors are expressive and focused, showing density and richness.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Virtue 2018 Vitality Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from one of the state's top vineyards, satsuma, orange-oil and plum aromas lead to palate-staining purple-fruit flavors. It's a textbook example of what there is to love about this variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: DeLille 2017 Red Willow Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a fun and sprightly take on Malbec by the students at this Santa Maria college, starting with crisp aromas of black raspberry, seared beef and crumbled flowers. There is a peppery spice to the palate, where white-pepper, dried meat and fresh raspberry flavors converge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Allan Hancock 2018 Malbec (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted cherry, light clove, caramel and a hint of baked fennel show on the nose of this bottling. Hearty flavors of blackberry meet with licorice on the palate, which is balanced by just enough acid.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Europa Village 2017 C'est la Vie Malbec (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dark aromas of black currant, prune and bourbon show on the nose of this bottling. There is intense fruit character to the palate, where lavish tannins frame flavors of smoked fig paste, thick cassis and loads of vanilla.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kaena 2016 Stag Canyon Vineyard Malbec (Los Olivos District)

Description: One of three wines produced by California-based consultant Paul Hobbs in partnership with the Vigouroux family in Cahors, this is a rich, densely textured blend across different terroirs. It is concentrated, showing licorice flavors as well as black fruit and some firm extraction. So even after four years, the wine needs to soften. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Paul Hobbs & Bertrand Gabriel Vigouroux 2016 Crocus L'Atelier  (Cahors)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Lightly colored in the glass, this bottling begins with aromas of raspberry juice, toasted peppercorns, cured meat and charcoal on the nose. The mouthfeel is both delicate and taut, with flavors of smashed cranberry, light pepper and savory meats. It is a light style of Malbec.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wilson Creek 2017 Reserve Malbec (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Toasted grape-seed, dried herbs and black-currant aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is solid black fruit to the palate, where cedar and eucalyptus spice also make for an herbal kick.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Martin Ranch 2016 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Malbec (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: A rich and dense wine that has concentrated black fruits, firm tannins and bold, juicy richness. The wine is balanced, with its structure showing well against the fruit. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2018 Cahors  (Cahors)

Description: Made without added sulfur, this wine has fine black fruits and a texture that is already smoothing out. There are plenty of dark fruits tones as well as ripe tannins, with plenty of acidity to balance. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vincens 2019 P.U.R.E.  (Cahors)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and mature-tasting wine offers dried herb and balsamic aromas, tomato-leaf and raisin flavors and a lightly tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Arianna 2017 Malbec (Red Hills)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Eye-opening aromas of graphite and coffee bean lead to absolutely dense black-fruit flavors wrapped in layers of fine-grained tannins. This is an imposing full-bodied wine that's impressive in its depth and structure. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Chacewater 2015 Krev Malbec (Lake County)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas jump out of the glass, with notes of Damson plum, tar and spice. The palate is intensely flavorful but still brings a sense of tartness and freshness. It's a standout, textbook offering of this variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Latta 2017 Weinbau Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Concentrated black-fruit aromas alongside hints of cardamom and coriander open this lush Malbec. Blackberry, cassis and dark plum flavors are pure and agile on the palate. Enjoy through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luca 2018 Old Vine Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Full and lush dark-berry aromas open this lusty blend of Malbecs from high-quality Paraje Altamira. While fully extracted, there's grip to the palate. Deep currant and wild berry flavors are nicely spiced, while this is fit and on the money through the finish. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tikal 2016 Amorio A Blend of Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Description: Plum and cassis aromas are friendly in a lightly candied sort of way. The full-bodied palate is emboldened by acidity, while this Malbec from gravelly soils in Paraje Altamira tastes of saucy plum and berry fruits along with integrated oak. A firm, boxed-in finish is slightly herbal and savory in flavor. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Finca La Escuela La Grava Colección Suelos
Name: TintoNegro 2016 Finca La Escuela La Grava Colección Suelos Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Description: Full plum and berry aromas are inviting and offer just a hint of oaky vanilla. A fresh palate is braced by high-energy acidity that renders this Malbec zesty in feel. A quick blast of red berry and currant flavors stays juicy and bright through the finish. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Puramun 2016 Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Ripe berry aromas include a dried-fruit note of prune along with beneficial accents of cinnamon and cardamom. A firm and full-bodied palate deals ripe dark-berry flavors backed by coffee and caramel. A finish with dry tannins doesn't waver.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Gaucho Select Reserve Estate Grown and Bottled
Name: Zolo 2018 Gaucho Select Reserve Estate Grown and Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A dark berry aroma is toasty and oaky on the nose. This middleweight Malbec from an excellent vintage features grainy tannins, with black plum and cassis flavors backed by notable oak. Mild oak spice and lasting berry fruit flavors drive an undemanding finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Pascual Toso 2018 Reserva Barrancas Vineyards Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From the Shoemaker Vineyard, this bottling begins with aromas of baked black cherry, cardamom and cola, proving very lush and enticing on the nose. The richness carries to the sip, where black-cherry, coffee-cream and vanilla flavors align.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tehachapi 2018 Malbec (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Deep blackberry and cassis aromas hold up to scrutiny, while this perennially impressive Malbec from Luján de Cuyo delivers a bold palate, with tons of fruit but also balancing acidity. Toasty blackberry flavors are backed by peppery spice and a touch of charred oak on the finish. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Trivento 2017 Golden Reserve Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: A popping, lively nose includes berry fruit and stalky notes, while this feels dry, snappy and slightly tartaric on the palate. Plum and wild berry flavors are salty and finish with dry tannins. Drink this tight, crisp Malbec through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Famiglia Mosso 2018 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Berry and plum aromas come with a meaty accent on the nose. This Malbec from a strong vintage offers juicy acidity and medium overall intensity. Lightly spicy plum and berry flavors are slightly gamy and wild on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alta Vista 2018 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Piercing berry aromas come with hints of hot stones and rose petals. A tight, bright palate delivers red currant and plum flavors that pop across a fresh, zesty finish. Befitting a cool and wet year like 2016, this Malbec is direct in style. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Pampas del Sur 2016 Gran Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dark berry aromas are earthy, spicy and a touch edgy in front of a lively palate of prickly acidity and mild tartaric burn. Generous black-fruit flavors are backed by toasty depth, while this holds a tight line on a finish that's slightly fiery. Fire up a steak for this one; drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Maal 2017 Imposible Malbec (Vista Flores)

Description: Lemon, a touch of char and edgy red-berry aromas open this racy Malbec. Berry and plum flavors come with chocolate and spice notes, while dry tannins and mild heat make for a slightly rugged finish. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Hermandad 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Full ripeness on nose is reflected through malty aromas of cassis, raisin and prune, while this feels lush on the palate. Blackberrry, raisin and oak-based café mocha flavors play out on a smooth finish with soft tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Rubus 2018 Icono Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Lemon, a touch of char and edgy red-berry aromas open this racy Malbec. Berry and plum flavors come with chocolate and spice notes, while dry tannins and mild heat make for a slightly rugged finish. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Hermandad 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Spicy berry aromas come with a hint of Graham cracker and a wild note of a hot summer field. A firm palate is tightened by inward-pulling tannins, while this tastes of roasted berry fruits, plums and herbs. Dry tannins and lifted acidity make for an active finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Proemio 2018 Reserve Single Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dark berry aromas are moderately reduced, leaving notes of olive and iodine on the nose. A full but fresh mouthfeel and spicy, lightly herbal plum and berry flavors work towards a finish that shows salty overtones and a little wildness befitting a vineyard-designated wine. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Enrique Foster 2017 Single Vineyard Finca Los Barrancos Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe berry aromas fill out a convincing nose, while this unoaked Malbec shows intensity and bold acidity on the palate. Fresh berry and black plum flavors are clean and easy to enjoy. Overall, this delivers purity, verve and quality fruit.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Maal 2018 Biutiful Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A closed nose with acceptable reduction smells of blackberry and olive, while this feels grippy and expansive on a palate. Toasty berry and plum flavors are slightly blackened, while this simmers on low heat across a finish with tartaric burn.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Recuerdo 2017 Aliado Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Ramona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh aromas of ripe blackberry and blueberries meet with hints of sweet oak on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers fruity blackberry-juice flavors, with hints of baking spice and dried herbs, finishing on a toasty oak element.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Chuparosa 2016 Malbec (Ramona Valley)

Description: Bright berry aromas are a touch foxy prior to a blocky palate with soft tannins. Lightly herbal blackberry and black currant flavors show welcome spice notes on the finish along with mild heat and burn.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Argento 2018 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Roasted berry aromas are earthy and rubbery, with a raw edge to the nose. This Malbec is full in body, with tomato-like acidity lending lift. Plum and herbal berry flavors come with pasty oak notes, while this tastes meaty, saucy and slightly green on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Cobos 2018 Felino Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Dark and tannic, with black currant fruit, this high-octane effort starts out with a blast of espresso. Though immediately ripe and potent, the fruit flavors thin out quickly, leaving astringent tannins through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: JosephJane 2018 Malbec (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dense in the glass and on the nose, this bottling begins with aromas of stewed black fruits and caramel. It's thick on the palate with cassis and oak flavors, framed by rather stiff tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Clos La Chance 2017 Reserve Malbec (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: Muted plum and cassis aromas are deep down in the glass, while this feels jammy and loosely balanced. Dark plum flavors are baked and soft, while this tastes a bit stewed on a simplistic finish. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Lamadrid 2015 Single Vineyard Gran Reserva Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: A black cherry aroma is a touch raw and herbal in front of a palate that's fresh and lean. Crisp black plum and berry flavors come with a hint of beet juice, while this is firm and smacking on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Trivento 2018 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Mild berry fruit aromas are offset by leafy compost notes in this herbal tasting Malbec. A spicy, slightly green and oaky tasting finish feels tight.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viejo Isaias 2018 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Raisiny plum and berry aromas come across as baked and heavy, while this feels tight and shows juicy acidity but not a lot of structure or body. Dark plum and currant flavors are draped with savory overtones prior to a short finish with sharp acidity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casir Dos Santos 2018 Avatar Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With fruit coming from Antoine Creek Vineyard, light aromas of varnish and cherry lead to tart, sleek, center-focused flavors. The variety seems hard to find.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Succession 2018 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A blast of rubbery berry fruit aromas comes with a latex note. A sharp palate with blazing acidity yields currant and vanilla flavors that break up on a lean, popping finish. This is a fiery wine from a difficult year.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ginard Ballester 2015 Gran Reserva Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Description: Strained herbal fruit aromas yield to rawness and smokiness. An acidic palate with tension and the sensation of chomping on grape skins deals stalky red plum and berry flavors, while dry tannins make for a severe finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2017 Reserva High Altitude Vineyards Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A reduced nose smells of muddled berry fruits and black olive. On the palate, this is wide and grabby, with prodding acidity. Tart, saucy black plum flavors show some burn and latent heat on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alpamanta 2018 Natal Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Thin fruit touches on generic red berries, but the dominating flavors are vanilla and tobacco. Whether from new or used oak, or some other oak treatment, this overtakes any and all varietal specificity and terroir.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Sweet Cheeks 2017 Malbec (Southern Oregon)

Description: Rubbery plum and berry aromas are gamy. The full-bodied palate is cut like a razor by shearing acidity, while berry and plum flavors are green and herbal. This brings the power but also rawness and a green core.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Enrique Foster 2015 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Fiery aromas of cinnamon, spearmint and grass meet flavors of root beer, milk chocolate, oak grain and weedy fruit.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Adelma 2015 El Capitan Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Fermented and aged in wood, this is a richly structured wine. With its fine, ripe blackberry fruits that contrast with the firm tannins, it is still developing. It shows great density and plenty of aging potential. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Eugénie 2017 Haute Collection  (Cahors)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Loads of dark-cocoa, sandalwood, cassis and black-plum tang show on the nose of this bottling. There is intensity and richness to the palate, where roasted black currant and blackberry ride creamy tannins into a finish full of acidic pop.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Daou 2017 Malbec (Adelaida District)

Description: Apart from the heavy bottle, this is a fine, richly impressive wine. Named after the 15th century owner of the estate, the wine comes from selected parcels. Aged in wood, it is dense, richly structured and full of the ripest black plum fruits. It's impressive and ageworthy. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Château de Haute-Serre Cuvée Géron Dadine de Haute-Serre
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2017 Château de Haute-Serre Cuvée Géron Dadine de Haute-Serre  (Cahors)

Description: From vineyards on a high plateau east of the city of Cahors, this wine is powerfully structured while having a fine, elegant backdrop. Jammy black fruits are restrained by tannins, giving density to the wine as well as layered acidity and spice. The wine needs more time, so wait until 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2017 Château de Haute-Serre  (Cahors)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The achingly pure aromas of wild strawberry, ground rock, earth, spice and herb are arresting. The palate brings all that and more, with notes of herb, and spice that show delicacy, purity and restraint along with a whole lot of acidity. This is as far from a cocktail wine as it gets and needs food alongside it to be fully appreciated. Paired it with grilled lamb chops.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2018 Dineen Vineyard Côt (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: From vineyards surrounding the medieval castle of Mercuès, the wine is classic Malbec: rich and full of dense black fruits and tannins. It is an impressive wine, wood-aged and sure to hold well. Drink from 2021 at the earliest.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2017 Château de Mercuès  (Cahors)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Beautifully focused and polished, this inviting and flavorful wine offers black-cherry and black-currant flavors accented by subtle vanilla and cinnamon. It's deep and dark and velvety.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cuda Ridge 2017 Malbec (Livermore Valley)

Description: The main wine from this grand Cahors estate is rich in dark tannins and concentrated black fruits. It is still young, because the wine's structure is dry and dense. Let it soften over the next year or so and drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lagrézette 2017  Cahors

Description: This is a bold, ripe wine from a top Cahors producer. It has dense tannins without too much weight, giving aging potential to the ripe fruit. Spice and blackberry flavors have plenty of life ahead of them. Drink this fine wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2018 Tradition  (Cahors)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Raspberry aromas jump out of the glass, along with notes of plum, whole orange, cigar box and herb. The palate is plush with plump chocolate flavors. It's a complete delight, with more structure than is often seen on this variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Novelty Hill 2017 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Delicious black-fruit and baking-spice flavors are wrapped in velvety tannins as this full-bodied, generous and mouthfilling wine brings everything together nicely. It is something new and exciting from always consistent Bogle.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bogle 2016 Reserve Malbec (Red Hills)

Description: A selection from the best parcels of the Mercuès vineyard, the wine is, as its name suggests, made to impress.
