It is also intended for aging, because this hugely rich wine, with black fruits and big tannins, has a way to go. It will open out and develop into a fine wine. Just wait until 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Château de Mercuès Icône Wow  (Cahors)

Description: This fine wood-aged wine is rich in tannins as well as generous spicy flavors. The wine's ripeness has been transformed into generous secondary flavors. It is very much ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Antisto Tradition  (Cahors)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This deeply colored, quietly potent wine broods in tones of dark chocolate, blueberry jam and baking spices wrapped in layers of thick, fine-grained tannins. Everything is held together tightly, yet softly.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Matchbook 2018 Black's Station Malbec (Yolo County)

Description: Generous and smoothly textured, the wine is approaching maturity. With its full black fruits, shot through with acidity and a firm core of tannins, the wood-aged wine is likely to be ready to drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2017 Château Pech de Jammes  (Cahors)

Description: This is a finely structured, rich and juicy wine. Blueberry fruit flavors are shot through with great acidity as well as layers of tannins that give backbone to the wine's fruitiness. The wine combines a dry core with plenty of fine fruitiness. Drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2018 Atrium Malbec de Cahors  (Cahors)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of plum, blackberry, coffee, vanilla and sweet barrel spices. Ripe, rich flavors follow, interlaced with barrel spice and orange peel notes. The tannins give the firm handshake that this vineyard is known for. Some bottle time will serve it well. Best after 2024.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kontos 2017 Baker Blend Summit View Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: A finely balanced, rich wine, this both dense and elegant. Spice and a dry core of tannins are both very much in evidence at this stage, although both will soften in time. It has power and concentration, and aging potential. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ponzac 2018  Cahors

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Winemaker JP Valot makes this along with a Malbec rosé. The ‘Bare White' version is a very pale copper hue, with aromas of peppery herbs, thistle and pine. The fruit touches rhubarb and wild strawberries. It's a delicate but interesting light white produced from this red grape.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Valcan 2019 Bare White Malbec Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Description: From grapes grown on the third terrace above the River Lot, this wine is open, ripe with juicy black fruits. Tannins have been softened by wood aging although they are still present and offer the potential for further aging. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lagrézette 2018 Chevalier du Château Lagrézette  (Cahors)

Description: This is the second wine from the Mercuès estate which surrounds a stunning medieval castle. The wine's density and solid black fruits are balanced by an elegant structure. Like any proper second wine it is developing quickly and is likely to be ready from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Château de Mercuès Le Vassal de Mercuès
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2018 Château de Mercuès Le Vassal de Mercuès  (Cahors)

Description: This is a generous, softly textured view of Cahors. Velvet tannins and ripe black fruits give a plush feel lifted by the fragrant acidity. The wine can age, so drink at its best from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2018 du Clos  (Cahors)

Description: This dense wine, produced by the Poncié family, is packed with tannins that show initial extraction and a hard edge before expanding into riper blackberry flavors and fresher acidity. Give this wine more time to soften and drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château les Grauzils 2018 Initial  (Cahors)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Darker than Valcan's White Malbec, this is sourced from the same (Kelly) vineyard, and seems to have had extra skin contact prior to pressing. It's rose pink, tank fermented and tastes principally of mixed herbs and citrus. The only knock is a bit of the freshness has been lost, and the finish falls a little flat. Drink up.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Valcan 2019 Rosé of Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Description: A generous burst of blackberry flavors sets the scene for this attractive, softly textured wine. With light tannins and juicy fruitiness, the wine is full, generous and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2018 Gouleyant  (Cahors)

Description: A wine that gives the lie to the idea that Malbec is necessarily tannic. This is soft with just touches of dryness that support the ripe berry fruits and gentle structure. It is a fruity wine, ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2018 Pigmentum  (Cahors)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bittersweet chocolate aromas are out front, followed by notes of cedar, dried herb and plentiful barrel spices. The palate doesn't quite deliver on all of that promise, dipping in the middle before coming back together on the finish. There's an impressive amount of tannic stuffing for the variety. Perhaps it will fill in over time.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Januik 2017 Champoux Vineyard Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: This ready-to-drink wine has an edge of dryness that contrasts with the blackberry and spice flavors. Fruity but also structured, drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2017 du Clos  (Cahors)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Plum, satsuma, baking spice and cherry aromas are followed by center focused flavors. The bright acidity of the vintage helps keep the interest. It doesn't all meld right now, but perhaps some time will bring it together?                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kontos 2017 Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Root beer and older oak aromas show alongside extracted dark fruit on the nose of this bottling. There is decent heft to the palate, where cola and baked blackberry-pie flavors are spiced by vanilla and nutmeg.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Plan B 2015 Malbec (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A spicy nose displays tobacco and medicinal dark fruit notes. Juicy dark berries carry the palate, with tart acidity and sandy tannins surrounding it all.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2018 Villa des Causses Malbec (Vin de France)

Description: Full bodied and moderately tannic, this muscular wine offers sunbaked fruit, dusty balsamic aromas and flavors and a palate-gripping texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wise Villa 2017 Malbec (California)

Description: A soft red from Languedoc, the wine has spice, a touch of wood aging and juicy blackberry fruits. Made to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de l'Herré 2018 La Galope Rouge Malbec (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Aromas of baked plum and blueberry meld with a touch of vanilla. The palate offers rich baked fruit flavors met by hot spice and hulking tannins.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Promesses de France 2019 Malbec (Vin de France)

Description: Complexity not saturation and extraction describes the nose, which features aromas of desert scrub, plum, raspberry and rose petals. A racy palate is composed and balanced, while this is generous with its plum, berry and peppery spice flavors. A long, composed finish confirms that this is a superb Malbec from a wet year in Argentina. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Siete Fincas 2016 Gran Secreto Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Firm, supple tannins support an earthy, herbal undercurrent of cedar, pencil lead and sweet tobacco in this varietal wine. A rich blueberry flavor explodes on the palate, while a leathery texture melds with a hint of dark chocolate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Devil Proof 2017 Farrow Ranch Malbec (Alexander Valley)

Description: Bold black-fruit aromas are slightly reduced and tarry at first, but with airing alluring herbal notes and complexity take over. While this is fully ripe and full in body and color, it's lively in feel. Toasty, almost charred oak goes toe to toe with deep black-fruit flavors. All of this is backed by a smoky, chocolaty finish. A huge success for a 2016, a year marred by rain. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Kaiken 2016 Mai The First Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A dark purple-meets-black color and concentrated black-fruit aromas set up an extracted palate that's grapy and pulpy but not soft, jammy or out of balance. Inky blackberry and cassis flavors come with notes of charred oak, graphite and peppery spice, while this is bold but focused and controlled on a grabby finish. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Piedras Viejas El Challao Las Heras
Name: Matervini 2017 Piedras Viejas El Challao Las Heras Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A saturated blackish purple color and reduced aromas of black olive, road tar and ultimately savory black fruits open this power-packed Malbec. A deeply fruity palate is braced by rugged tannins, while this tastes decidedly toasty and dark, with crusty black-fruit flavors touched up by herbs and oak. Toastiness and coffee notes remain up front on a sizable finish; drink through 2032.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luca 2016 Nico Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This bold, brawny wine opens on tones of blueberry and graham cracker, with a flow of seductive tannins and toasted oak. Lifted acidity complements the overriding fruit intensity, with strong fistfuls of black pepper, tobacco and clove playing beneath.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Devil Proof 2017 Rockpile Ridge Malbec (Rockpile)

Description: Ripe black-fruit aromas are potent and meaty, with complex notes of savory beef stew and black coffee. A full palate is plush and stylish, while this high-elevation Malbec tastes of blackberry, cassis and savory herbs. Black-fruit flavors remain forceful on a finish with good depth and great feel; drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2017 Grand High Altitude Vineyards Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Savory, beefy blackberry aromas are lightly herbal and minty, which helps boost the complexity factor on this lush, bold Malbec that benefits from juicy acidity. Wild berry, dark plum and integrated oak flavors linger on a bright finish that's more fresh than heavy. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luca 2017 Nico Rosas Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Exotic aromas familiar to the Calchaquí Valleys of Salta include blueberry, blackberry, cardamom, fennel and leather. The palate on this highly individual Malbec is deep but lifted by a shock of bright acidity. Berry fruit flavors are oaky and aided by Middle Eastern spice notes. A steady finish of medium length and depth is the final chapter to this small-production Malbec. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Matervini 2017 Antes Andes Valles Calchaquíes Malbec (Salta)

Description: Floral blueberry aromas come with a note of cardamom on what is an exotic nose. A tight palate with drawing tannins deals spiced plum flavors backed by dry oakiness. This Malbec is long on the finish with spicy barrel notes. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Potrero 2016 Gran Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: An array of classy aromas include plum, currant, spice, graphite and even hot desert stones. The palate on this old-vines Malbec is edgy, with rubbing tannins and driving acidity. Chocolaty oak flavors blend with herbal berry fruit, while this big wine from a difficult vintage finishes with lasting chocolaty oak. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: TintoNegro 2016 1955 Vineyard Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: Fresh, almost minerally plum and berry aromas are spot-on for an everyday Malbec such as this. A bright, juicy palate has verve along with depth and balance, while plum and berry flavors come with a light hint of helpful oak. Spice and chocolate notes play out on a finish that offers some complexity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Navarro Correas 2018 Colección Privada Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe berry aromas are at the heart of a smooth nose, while this red shows the freshness and snap that high-elevation Uco Valley Malbec is known for. Blackberry, cassis, coffee and spice flavors finish dark and toasty, with some good intensity. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2017 Famiglia Bianchi Gran Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling shows black-cherry jam and nutmeg aromas on the nose. There's a satisfying viscosity on the palate, where rich blackberry and licorice flavors lead into a caramel and vanilla finish, with fresh acidity to keep it in check.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Opaque 2017 Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: Ripe, earthy berry aromas are on the savory and leathery side, while this pulls inward on the palate due to racy acidity. Tangy berry and black plum flavors are lightly herbal, while this doesn't show a lot besides mild oak on a long finish driven by perky acidity. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: The Pledge 2017 1000 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Bold black fruit aromas come with a light blanket of oak. On the palate, this feels lively and juicy, making it food-friendly. Dark plum, blackberry and mild spice flavors finish with a jolt of acidity. While this delivers nothing unusual or riveting, it's a surefire Malbec for drinking now.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Reserva Estate Bottled 12 Meses en Roble
Name: Los Haroldos 2017 Reserva Estate Bottled 12 Meses en Roble Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dark berry aromas are pure, with good depth. This is flush and packed with fruit on a balanced palate, while typical Mendoza Malbec flavors of spicy dark-berry fruits finish lightly toasty and peppery. Everything about this is right and approachable.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dante Robino 2017 Reserva Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Berry and plum aromas are full and lightly dusty and earthy. A plump palate is braced by juicy acidity, while flavors of plum and berry fruits are touched up by a hint of grainy oak. Overall, this is a smooth and solid Malbec that should elicit zero complaints.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Angulo Innocenti 2017 Nonni Estate Grown Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: Berry aromas are pleasant and ripe, with an herbal note in the backdrop. A fleshy, fruity palate is easy to process, while this Malbec tastes of lightly spiced oak, raspberry and cassis. A steady finish confirms the wine's overall quality.                      Michael Schachner
Name: The Show 2018 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Berry and plum aromas are on the jammy side, while this is full in body and generally well balanced. Spicy, lightly herbal berry and plum flavors are backed by a woody accent, while on the finish this is firm in feel, spicy and has an oaky aftertaste.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Pampas del Sur 2017 Estilo Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A dark color and relatively deep aromas of black fruits, iodine and minerals lead to a concentrated palate that's fairly serious in terms of complexity. Blackberry, cassis and spice flavors finish with a touch of heat.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viñalba 2018 Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Wild berry aromas come with a touch of oak spice, while this feels bright with notable but controlled acidic bite. Spicy dark-berry flavors are lightly oaked as this weakens on a finish with minty herbal hints.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Almarada 2017 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine, this opens in thick, brawny tannins and oak before allowing room to reveal smoothly robust flavors of leather, pepper and blackberry jam. Relatively light in style, it has measured ripeness and length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Ripe berry and cassis aromas include raisin and prune notes. Herbal, spicy berry and desiccated plum flavors are a touch green, while this finishes with heft and minty, peppery touches.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Iaccarini 2017 Cavas Don Nicasio Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dusty berry and black plum aromas come with a hint of oak-driven milk chocolate. A full palate tastes of generic berry fruits and cocoa, while grainy oak notes on the finish remain in the chocolaty zone. This is a perfectly nice Malbec to drink now through 2021.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Toneles 2017 Tonel 46 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Berry aromas are lightly reduced at first, with notes of fresh asphalt and purple flowers. The medium-bodied palate shows a deft touch, while it tastes of bright berry fruits. The finish of this organic Malbec is juicy and steady.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2019 Virgen Organic Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Berry and plum aromas are matched by grainy, toasty oak that lends darkness to how this opens. A full and fleshy palate is home to dark berry, spice and oaky flavors, while this Malbec runs long on a woody tasting finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Flichman 2018 Reserva Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Spicy berry and plum aromas are reedy, while this has a clamping palate and rubbing tannins. Hard spice flavors accent herbal, minty berry flavors. On the finish, this is dry and rubbing.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Lamadrid 2019 Single Vineyard Malbec (Agrelo)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry and cherry-paste aromas meet with wild mint on the nose of this bottling. Black-plum, lilac and lavender flavors show on the slightly sour palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Midnight 2017 Solstice Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: Wiry plum and berry aromas are on the raw and briny side, with a hint of green. A drying, tannic palate holds underdeveloped plum and currant flavors that finish herbal and a bit oaky.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2017 Don Nicanor Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Spicy berry fruit aromas come with mild herbal notes. This Malbec is decidedly fresh and snappy, with grapy berry flavors that include wild brush notes that push rusticity. A simple but solid finish makes this easy to process.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodini 2019 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy plum aromas include a note of raspberry, while a medium-depth palate ranks as fleshy and pulpy. Blackberry and currant flavors are maintained on the finish. For everyday purposes this gets it right.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bastante Bien 2019 Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Reedy red berry aromas in this unoaked Malbec offer a hint of charred beef and cinnamon-like spice. A bright, lively palate is medium in body, while this tastes of juicy plum and peppery spice prior to a finish that's youthful and a touch fiery.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Proemio 2019 Origins Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Savory berry aromas are more stewed than bright and fruity, while this is basic on the palate. Herbal red fruit flavors are lightly spiced and a touch green, while this finishes similarly.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Qaramy 2018 Latido Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Berry and plum aromas are a touch spicy but also a bit grassy upon deeper inspection. An acidic palate is fresh and lean, but chippy. Tart plum flavors are backed by spice notes, while this Malbec finishes fresh.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Santa Julia 2019 [+] Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Malbec from 6 Prong and Angiolina vineyards, the aromas offer notes of eucalyptus, pine and spice, with the barrel at the fore. Plump dark-fruit and barrel flavors follow, with lightly grainy tannins in support. The variety seems to get a little lost, but it's interesting.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Stottle 2015 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Standard berry aromas are ripe and inviting, while this feels spunky and alert. Berry and plum flavors are touched up with peppery spice notes, while this fades out with some heat and aggression.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tussock Jumper 2019 Malbec (San Juan)

Description: Asphalt and charred aromas give this Malbec a dark outlook on the nose, while the palate is basic and narrow in feel. Herbal plum and chocolaty oak flavors include a hint of green.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Flichman 2018 Misterio Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of cherry and blackberry-fruit leather are followed by quite ripe fruit flavors. The warmth of the vintage shows, with the fruit seeming desiccated.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Mount Si 2016 Lonesome Springs Ranch Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Description: Cranberry and jammy red berry scents come with a hint of cinnamon powder. A tight, juicy palate is linear, while spicy red berry and plum flavors finish bright but a little raw.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Nampe 2019 Natural Expression Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Plum and herbal grassy notes define the nose on this Patagonian Malbec. High acidity makes for a gritty, grinding palate, while black fruit and plum flavors are peppery prior to a dry, acidic finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Manos Negras 2019 Quimay Malbec (Río Negro Valley)

Description: Herbal plum aromas are dusted with cinnamon-like spice notes, while this feels punchy on the palate. Generic berry and baking spice flavors are mild on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Los Haroldos 2018 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Prickly, sharp-edged aromas of herbal berry fruits announce a scratchy Malbec. Charred oak covers green-leaning berry flavors, followed by mild bitterness. A full-feeling finish is hot and herbaceous.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casir Dos Santos 2017 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Muddled, earthy berry aromas are roasted and herbal in true Cafayate fashion. A firm palate deals gritty cranberry flavors, with a rustic peppery quality to the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Quara 2019 Estate Malbec (Cafayate)

Description: A wiry nose with citric leanings and grassy overtones is low on perceptible ripeness. Herbal red fruit flavors show better than the nose, while this closes with a touch of green. While not a bad wine, this Malbec reflects Patagonia's cooler climate.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Malma 2018 Finca La Papay Malbec (Patagonia)

Description: Warm, leathery aromas turn toward muddled and green after airing. Herbal berry and spice flavors are lightly minty, while heat is a component of an herbal finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Graffigna 2018 Malbec (San Juan)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A blender's worth of aromas includes notes of lactic oak, graphite, vanilla, asphalt and berry fruits. On the palate, this is extracted and voluminous, with lemony oak. Black-fruit flavors are molten, while this Malbec is spicy as it deals tobacco notes. A charred, toasty finish is loaded with blackened spice, clove and peppery accents. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Enrique Foster 2013 Firmado Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: A saturated purple color and concentrated aromas of blackberry, cassis, prune and vanilla lead to a lush, pure palate that's ripe but balanced. Deep plum, blackberry, cassis and raisin flavors are full and delicious, while this Malbec pours on the spice notes on the rich finish. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Salentein 2015 Pr1mum Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Aromas of cumin and cardamom meld with blackberry, cassis and chocolate on the nose. This lush Malbec is in balance, with tannins still waiting to soften. Blackberry, dark plum and cassis flavors finish flush and with fruity carry over. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Don Nicanor Single Vineyard Villa Blanca Old Vines
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2014 Don Nicanor Single Vineyard Villa Blanca Old Vines Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Ripe cassis and raisin aromas include welcome notes of marzipan and vanilla. This is thorough and lush on the palate, with weight and depth. Chocolate, vanilla and spice accents aid core blackberry and cassis flavors, while this is luscious and loaded on a rich, ripe finish; drink through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Penedo Borges 2015 Icono Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: Ripe black-fruit aromas tip into the raisin and prune zone. A saturated palate is hard and intense, indicating that this can age for another five to 10 years. Ripe, chocolaty dark-fruit flavors are rich and slightly raisiny, while this monster Malbec is toasty, warm and tastes of black licorice on the finish. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Antigal 2013 One Doña Angeles Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A pitch-black color and ripe aromas of cassis, raisin, vanilla and cocoa set up a lush palate that's made less jammy by tartaric acidity. Vanilla, mocha and blackberry flavors finish with more of the same before settling on prune, cassis and creamy oak.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Andrico 2014 Gran Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Dark-berry and cool-earth aromas are more dense than complex, while this feels jammy and wide, with cheek-to-cheek tannins. Spicy oak flavors are matched by blackberry and chocolate notes, while this feels a touch edgy and hot on a finish with some fire to it. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Toneles 2015 Abrasado Unique Parcel Gran Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Floral berry, exotic spice, cinnamon and oak aromas lead to a full, jammy palate that's layered and generous with fruit. Blackberry, plum, chocolate and baking-spice flavors roll towards a smooth, solid finish that seems to be near maturity. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tapiz 2014 Black Tears Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is an impressively robust ripe red wine, abundant in bright red fruit and coconut. It finds a complementary savory side in the form of leather, black pepper and dried herb—components that integrate well onto a lengthy, integrated finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Patel 2016 Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This mouth-watering wine is packed with watermelon and cherry flavors riding a fresh, crisp texture. It's lively, nicely concentrated and surprisingly full bodied.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Boatique 2019 Rosé of Malbec (Red Hills)

Description: A deep color, with violet rims and ripe berry, cassis, chocolate and vanilla aromas open this Gualallary single-vineyard Malbec. A full and fleshy body holds ripe berry flavors that tilt in the direction of prune and raisin, while the finish is slightly soft and raisiny but in the end quite tasty. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Single Vineyard Los Basaltos Estate Plot N°2
Name: Salentein 2015 Single Vineyard Los Basaltos Estate Plot N°2 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dark aromas of hot black top, prune, black coffee and cola surround ultraripe berry scents. On the palate, this bruiser is coarse and hot. Hard-pounding wild berry, cassis, chocolate and oaky flavors turn on the afterburners on a rugged, saturated finish. Take this on only if you like high-octane stuff.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Antigal 2010 One La Dolores Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A ripe and jammy mix of dark berry, prune and creamy oak aromas opens this full-bodied Malbec. Ripe berry and black-plum flavors veer towards raisin, while this is spicy and decidedly dark on a full and fleshy finish. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Budeguer 2017 4000 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Angular raspberry and plum aromas are helped by vanilla notes. A tight, well-formed palate is equally full and balanced, while this tastes of berry fruits and black plum, along with dark spices and black tea. A steady but short finish is direct before fading. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Caelum 2014 Reserva Estate Grown and Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe aromas of black plum and cassis are topped with an appealing oak tone. This is a fairly tight and fresh style of Malbec that shows black-fruit flavors on the palate aided by toasty oak. It finishes with firm tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Chakana 2017 Ayni Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Description: Attractive aromas of wild berry fruits, lavender and cardamom give this Malbec a sense of exotic quality. A full hard-driving palate is intense at first and then it coasts. Flavors of black olive, dark plum and savory spices are earthy, salty, mildly complex and impressive through the finish line.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Antigal 2017 Uno Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe berry aromas are woodsy and spicy, while this feels dense, jammy and chewy. Up-front oak is the lead flavor, followed by baked berry and spice notes. A firm finish, with rubbery tannins, is solid in feel and savory tasting, with a touch of complexity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Alicia 2015 Paso de Piedra Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Reductive, thick and spicy in cinnamon, this robust, full-bodied and substantial wine is complex and endlessly intense. Dark cherry, grilled meat and clove highlight firm supportive tannin and sweet oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Louis M. Martini 2016 Monte Rosso Malbec (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: This is an excellent choice for pink wine from Southern California, and a good example of a richer style of rosé. Rudy red in the glass, this begins with aromas of kirsch, red apple and watermelon Jolly Rancher on the nose. The palate combines berry, plum and cherry flavors, with a light kiss of herb and enough acidity to clean it all up.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Doffo 2019 Rosario Rosé of Malbec (Temecula Valley)

Description: A full nose with charred berry aromas is capped by smoky oak and graphite notes. This is a full, dense Malbec that's more thick and blocky than elegant. Charred oak, blackberry and coffee flavors finish dry, tannic and toasty.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alta Vista 2015 Terroir Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is pure varietal, offering juicy black cherry fruit. It's streaked with gunmetal and licorice, and lightly kissed with one-quarter new French oak that leaves a trailing impression of baker's chocolate.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Quady North 2016 Malbec (Applegate Valley)

Description: Juicy blueberry dominates in this robustly soft, smooth and rounded wine, which is able to integrate its tannins into additional lushness. The oak is supportive in adding structure and a hint of baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: H.L.R. Cellars 2016 Estate Malbec (Fountaingrove District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong aromas of cappuccino, mocha, black cherry and vanilla are very rich on the nose of this bottling. It's lush on the palate with cherry-pie and rose-water flavors, finishing on a blast of sweet smoke.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Opaque 2015 Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: Rocky minerally aromas of cherry and plum show a streak of toasty, minty oak. This Malbec feels tight, rubbery and clamping due to hard tannins. Oaky flavors of plum skins, blackberry and baking spices are chocolaty in front of a resiny finish with heat, dryness, mild bitterness and fierce tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ricardo Santos 2013 El Gran Malbec (Argentina)

Description: This full-bodied authentic-tasting wine emphasizes complex savory, peppery, grilled herb qualities and backs them up with tight cherry and cranberry flavors. Best through 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Akash 2017 Dreamville Malbec (California)

Description: Earthy, slightly mulchy berry aromas come with a note of black olive and tomato. A full palate maintains a stout feel, while this Malbec deals short black-fruit flavors, with herbal overtones and savory notes. A fleshy finish holds onto the wine's herbal tomato character.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Altocedro 2018 Año Cero Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: Plum, black-cherry and black-olive aromas check off the boxes of what good Mendoza Malbec should smell like. A fresh and direct palate features rubbing tannins, while this tastes of blackberry, dark plum and mixed spices. On the finish, this is steady and holds onto its shape.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tomero 2017 Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Chocolaty oak and raisiny berry aromas are out front on this blend of three vintages. Pushy oak is absorbed on the palate, while this tastes of chocolate, toast, hard spices and ripe black fruits. Baking-spice notes lend complexity to a dry, scratchy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Maal NV Paciencia Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A black color and chunky aromas of berry fruits, green herbs, graphite and oak lead to a full, sappy palate, with depth and chewy tannins. Prune and raisin flavors are out front on a full and ripe flavor profile, while this Malbec is grabby on a fairly short but steady finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Antigal 2016 Aduentus Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A dark, concentrated color and grapy, slightly reduced dark-berry aromas open this round but edgy Malbec from the north of Argentina. Roasted berry and plum flavors are typical of the Calchaquí Valley, while this stays ripe on a plump finish that's more bold than elegant.                      Michael Schachner
Name: El Esteco 2017 Malbec (Calchaquí Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 22% Syrah, the wine features butterscotch, sweet barrel spice, coffee, plum and fresh cut wood aromas out front, with the oak taking over. The cherry and plum flavors struggle to get to the surface, with the tannins showing some astringency that settles over time. Despite being only 33% new French, the wood at times steals the show, even with all the other good things going on.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Sparkman 2016 Preposterous Malbec (Red Mountain)

Description: Medicinal berry and plum aromas are minty and a touch murky, with a covering of oak. Stand-out tartaric acidity makes for a hard, scratchy palate, while cherry, plum and berry flavors are a touch stalky and muddled. Choppiness returns on the finish, where the acidity is dominating.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mendoza Vineyards 2015 Gran Reserva by Richard Bonvin Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Rubber and reduced olive aromas are front and center, and thus this needs lots of air. A big, grabby palate is anchored by hard tannins, while this tastes dark and toasty, with blackberry flavors backed by a drying finish. This Malbec is full in scale, oaky and grabby, not elegant.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Alicia 2013 Las Compuertas Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Grapy blackberry and blueberry aromas are ripe and fruity. Given that opening, it's no shock that this feels extracted and saturated. Blackberry, toasty oak and graphite flavors extend onto a medium-length finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Areyna 2017 Estate Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Reduced, grapey berry and black-plum aromas are oaky and a bit heavy. A sappy, sticky palate is packed, while this popular-style Malbec tastes of chocolaty oak and black fruits. A fat, full finish is ripe on the surface but slightly green in the center.                      Michael Schachner
Name: La Posta 2018 Pizzella Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Early herbaceous aromas of juniper give way to savory berry scents. This feels tannic, with tomatoey acidity. Savory flavors of tomato, olive and berry fruits show a hint of chocolaty oak, while this is steady on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mendel 2017 Lunta Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Cola and rooty spice aromas dominate a nose that includes cassis and earthy raisin notes. This very ripe holdover from a hot vintage is heavy like a Mack truck. Equally heavy berry and prune flavors are at maximum ripeness, probably even overripe. Ditto for a raisiny finish that tastes medicinal.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Grand Vin Single Vineyard Old Vines
Name: Bodega Goulart 2009 Grand Vin Single Vineyard Old Vines Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Thick, intense and meaty, this hearty wine is full of grip, tar, black fruit and dried herb. Leathery texture gives in to supple tannin and a richness of oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: J. McClelland 2014 Malbec (Oak Knoll District)

Description: Raisin and prune aromas lead a heavy nose, with baked berry and cassis undertones. This is fat and thick on the palate, with tartaric acidity creating liveliness. Raisiny black-fruit flavors are enlivened by forced acidity on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alma de los Andes 2016 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Floral plum and berry aromas come with a dash of exotic spices. This everyday Malbec feels bold and lively, with good structure. Spicy berry and savory plum flavors knit together and finish in clean, easy fashion.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Black Cabra 2018 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Jammy berry aromas seem reduced and narrow. On the palate, this Malbec from a vintage marred by rain and rot feels sappy and linear, with unabsorbed acidity. Plum, spice and cocoa flavors come in front of a pulpy, jammy finish. While this tastes fairly good, it has its mouthfeel and balance issues.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Sophenia 2015 Synthesis Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Reedy, spicy berry aromas are wiry and include a hint of green. A tight, grating palate, with stand-out acidity, sets the stage for spicy, snappy and ultimately short berry flavors. Chop and shortness are continued themes on a finish that's racy at first and then shows oxidation. It seems like the difficulties of the 2015 vintage found this particular Malbec.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Puramun 2015 Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Earthy, roasted plum and black-fruit aromas are reduced at first and never that bright. On the palate, this Salta Malbec feels heavy and demanding. Ripe but short berry, spice and herbal flavors finish with a mix of wildness and sauvage notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: El Esteco 2018 Don David Reserve Malbec (Calchaquí Valley)

Description: Earthy berry aromas include notes of green tobacco and cigar ash. A tight, pinched palate is full of energy and exuberance, while this tastes of spicy oak forced onto generic black fruit. A spicy finish, with mild heat and mint notes, closes this out.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mendoza Vineyards 2018 Unsung Hero Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A blast of heavy oak greets you on the nose, leaving cool aromas of mint and red-berry fruits. On the palate, this is rather tight and grabby, with hard tannins. Spiced berry and plum flavors rank as oaky, while this is snappy on the finish but also a bit dry and short.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mendoza Vineyards 2017 1907 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Foxy berry aromas are earthy and savory, while this Malbec from a difficult year is hard and smacking on the palate. Salty, meaty, tomatoey flavors finish with grainy oak notes, medicinality and herbal berry leftovers.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Norton 2016 D.O.C. Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Prune and herbal berry aromas are woody and striving for harmony. A full, edgy and scraping palate deals flavors of prune, herbal blackberry and minty oak. On the finish, more mint and oaky clove notes enter the picture.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cicchitti 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A bulky black-fruit nose doesn't tread lightly, and thus it's no shock that this Malbec is heavy and weighted down by rubbery tannins. Savory black-fruit flavors show charred oak in front of lightly smoky finish with coffee notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2018 Reserve Made with Organic Grapes Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Heavy oak dominates a nose with creosote, herbal berry and chocolate aromas. On the palate, this is smacking and jumpy. Foxy berry and plum flavors come with a covering of forced oak, while this Malbec sticks to oak-based spice and clove flavors on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ernesto Catena 2017 Tahuan Siesta en el Tahuantinsuyu Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Spicy, highly herbal berry aromas are low on ripeness and fruit. This Malbec from a tough vintage feels chunky and grabby, with tartaric burn. Saucy berry and green-leaning flavors finish with rubbing tannins and flavor notes of basil, coffee and spice.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bressia 2016 Monteagrelo Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is impenetrably black in color, but thin in terms of flavor concentration. Light blackberry fruit fades quickly, and there are suggestions of bruised or overripe components.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Schmidt 2016 Malbec (Applegate Valley)

Description: Mild acidity boosts a midpalate of weighty viscosity in this concentrated wine, made from grapes grown on the BV Ranch 12 Vineyard intended specifically for this. It's meaty and flavorful.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Rosé of Malbec (Calistoga)

Description: Wiry plum and currant aromas are reedy, while this feels both fleshy and tannic. Spicy red-fruit flavors suggest currant and red plum, while this is raw but not astringent on a tight finish.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Fincas Finca La Perseverancia Finca Santa Herminia
Name: Alfredo Roca 2018 Fincas Finca La Perseverancia Finca Santa Herminia Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Jumpy aromas of earthy berry fruits are foxy. This Patagonian Malbec feels fresh, but after that there's little to the palate. Lightly green-plum and berry flavors precede a racy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: P15 2018 Estate Bottled Malbec (Patagonia)

Description: Oak spice, a hint of clove and generic berry aromas are noted on the nose. This Malbec feels grabby and gummy, while saucy berry flavors are nothing special. An herbal and tomatoey tasting finish is rubbing and grabby.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Pascual Toso 2018 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Volatility and reduction are noted on a mulchy nose. This Malbec feels heavy and stewed, while herbal berry flavors struggle. Green-tea notes dominate a finish that comes up short on freshness and purity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Funckenhausen 2015 La Espera Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Grapey black-plum aromas are heavy and familiar, while this feels compacted and saturated, with no bounce in its step. Jammy dark-fruit flavors are a bit raisiny, while heavy ripeness drives the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luis Segundo Correas 2018 Valle Las Acequias Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Black-fruit and asphalt aromas include an animal note and pasty oak. This Malbec is wide and formless, while saucy berry flavors are spiced up by forced oak. A dry, tannic finish is rough.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casir Dos Santos 2018 Maipe Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: With rich tannins and equally ripe fruit, this powerful wine offers concentration and a rich texture. Black-plum flavors give a juicy side to the wine, adding a fruity element to the aging potential. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2018 Calos Grande Réserve  (Cahors)

Description: This limited-production wine is named after the 13-foot statute of the Virgin Mary that stands in the vineyards. Perfumed from wood aging, it offers structure and tannins, bringing out ripe black fruits. Drink this powerful wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Cause 2018 Notre Dame des Champs  (Cahors)

Description: Wood aged for 24 months, this wine is dense, concentrated and powerful. Its tannins and equally concentrated fruit give the wine richness and plenty of further aging potential. Drink this impressive wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine les Roques de Cana 2016 Graal Sanctus  (Cahors)

Description: Latis, in the local dialect, means light and this wine pays homage to the luminous skies of Cahors. Mind you, there are only dark colors in this wine that accord with the dense tannins and rich black fruits. Still young and developing a balance between fruit and structure, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2018 Latis Grande Réserve  (Cahors)

Description: Superdark and flavorful, this densely concentrated wine manages to be both generous and firmly structured at the same time. It exudes graphite and cedar aromas, and boasts plenty of velvety, mouthcoating tannins to bolster a wealth of dark-chocolate, warm blueberry and blackberry flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Farm 2018 Estate Grown Malbec (Lodi)

Description: From a vineyard at one of the highest points of Cahors, this wine is impressive in both richness and mineral structure. Big tannins permeate the wine and demand time to soften. When they do, this wine will shine. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2018 Prieuré de Cénac  (Cahors)

Description: From the estate's oldest vineyards, planted in the 1960s, this wine is dense and structured. Tannins play across the surface, bringing aging potential. The wine is also ripe with berry flavors. Bring the elements together and the wine will be ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Cause 2017 La Lande Cavagnac  (Cahors)

Description: With its emphasis on jammy fruits and rounded tannins, this wine brings a new emphasis to Malbec in Cahors. Its dark texture is balanced by ripe fruits, smoky acidity and the juicy, succulent aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2018 La Vierge  (Cahors)

Description: Dark, firm and structured while also having generous jammy and ripe black fruits, this wine is well structured. Richness is balanced by great swathes of surging fruit and perfumed acidity. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2018 Château du Perry  (Cahors)

Description: Calos is the Celtic word for the stones in the vineyards of Cahors. This wine, with its firm tannins and mineral texture is set for aging. The black fruits and powerful structure are full bodied and dense. Drink the wine from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2018 Calos Reserve  (Cahors)

Description: Blueberry and black plum aromas meld with peppercorn and clove on the nose. The palate echoes the ripe berries of the nose, adding black currant, dried oak and toasted tobacco. Very dry, the acidity adds ripeness and richness to berry flavors and polishes the tannins that threaten to turn gritty. Cayenne and hatch chile tantalize the finish of this sultry Malbec.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Snowy Peaks 2017 Malbec (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are effusive, with appealing, fruit-forward notes of plum, black tea, dried herbs and vanilla. The palate delivers a mouthful of lush plum and vanilla flavors. Fruit and barrel both play leading roles.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Tunnel Hill 2016 Estate Bottled Malbec (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a formidable wine from the inky-dark color through a berry-soaked palate to a tannic finish. But it offers considerable and concentrated blackberry, cranberry and dark-chocolate notes to fill out the firm frame. Best through 2030.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Crystal Basin Cellars 2016 Grand Reserve Malbec (El Dorado)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of coffee, spice, whole Satsuma orange and plum are followed by well-balanced, palate-coating plum and Satsuma orange flavors. It's a big-time winner at this price. Best by 2023.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Canoe Ridge 2018 The Expedition Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: An open, ripe Malbec, this is elegant, rich in generous tannins and blackberry fruits. Its dense texture is developing well. Although the wine could be drunk now, it will be better from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2018 Latis Reserve  (Cahors)

Description: Rounded, soft and juicy, this Malbec is rich and generously textured. From an estate in the same family for six generations, it is ripe with blackberry flavors and contrasting acidity. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Caillou 2018 Malbec  (Cahors)

Description: Bright, buoyant black fruits signal a wine that is both ripe and layered with spice from wood aging and tannins. Made to be drunk young, the wine is ready now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2018 Mission de Picpus Malbec  (Cahors)

Description: A new wine from the estate, this is made to be drunk young in the Cahors ethic of wine. To achieve that it brings out black fruits and a light, spicy, peppery structure. Juicy flavors come through strongly at the end. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Cause 2018 Cosy de Cause  (Cahors)

Description: Wild berry fruits shine in this ripe wine. Wood aged for 18 months, it has a rich, smooth texture as well as dark tannins that are now softened into the spicy berry flavors. The wine is just maturing although it will be better from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine les Roques de Cana 2016 Domaine les Roques de Cana  (Cahors)

Description: Aromas of blueberry and plum are highlighted by pink peppercorn on the nose. Juicy and fruit-forward upfront, it's loaded with cherry, pomegranate and cranberry. Sweet vanilla tones emerge with sarsaparilla and oak tones. The acidity is juicy and bouncy, while tannins add just enough structure to keep things interesting. Spice elements rule the finish, lacing around the fruit core.                      Fiona Adams
Name: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2018 Malbec (Colorado)

Description: This smooth wine is richly textured and just mature. Fine tannins and juicy black fruits are in harmony, giving a powerful wine with ripe berry flavors and acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine les Roques de Cana 2017 Le Vin des Noces  (Cahors)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% varietal, with all the fruit coming from Block 19. The aromas bring pure, appealing notes of plum, Satsuma orange and spice. Soft, plush fruit flavors follow. Drink now.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Canoe Ridge 2017 Limited Edition Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Dark in color and rich in tannins, this black-fruit-flavored wine shows off its brightness. The structure is still firm in a wine that needs to develop. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Cause 2017 Tradition Malbec  (Cahors)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Baking spice and vanilla aromas are at the fore, with notes of plum struggling to get to the surface. The palate paints around the edges, with vanilla flavors down the middle. The oak gets in the way, which is a shame as the fruit is good and the acidity lovely.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Tunnel Hill 2017 Estate Malbec (Lake Chelan)

Description: Firmly structured while also exhibiting great black fruits, this wine has richness along with a juicy character. Tannins are fully integrated with the fruit and the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine les Roques de Cana 2016 Cuvée 1305  (Cahors)

Description: Nearly 12 years old, this wine is very much mature. Tannins dominate any fruit and richness, leaving a wine that is dry with only hints of mature juiciness. Definitely drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine les Roques de Cana 2008 Sanguis Christi  (Cahors)

Description: Aromas of wood smoke and dried meats meet tight smoky peppery flavors in this lean and tannic wine. It's out of the mainstream but a good option when looking for a purely organic, no-sulfites-added wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2018 Organic Malbec (Mendocino)

Description: This wine shows an unusual vegetal, flinty aroma and moderate flavors of peppercorns and cooked plums. It's a bit edgy but decent to drink.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Peirano 2018 The Heritage Collection Malbec (Lodi)

Description: Top of the mark, top of the heap is where this Malbec from Gualtallary in Tupungato ranks. Pure blackberry, cassis and plum aromas are impeccably clean and welcoming, while this feels squeaky fresh on the palate. Blackberry and dark chocolate flavors set up a minerally finish that plays out with fruity subtleties and stony infusions. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Michelini i Mufatto 2017 La Cautiva Malbec (Gualtallary)

Description: Former Achaval-Ferrer principals Santiago Achával and Roberto Cipresso crafted this Malbec from a vineyard planted in 1938. It offers a dense cassis aroma alongside notes of tire rubber, raw oak, graphite and vanilla. It feels structured and juicy on the palate, with firm tannins providing grip. Flavors of cassis, spiced plum and blueberry are notably oaky but never lose their focus. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Matervini 2017 Finca Malbec (Perdriel)

Description: A midnight dark color and rich, ripe aromas of cassis, raisin, vanilla and spice cake set up a saturated palate with wall-to-wall fruit. Oaky, jammy plum, cassis and blackberry flavors come with raisin and prune accents that play up this Malbec's core ripeness. On the finish, this is smooth and steady, with nothing hard or jagged. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mendel 2017 Finca Remota Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: The brothers Hector and Pablo Durigutti are making small-batch artisan wines in Las Compuertas, and this Malbec delivers the goods. A full, spicy nose with earthy black fruit aromas is rugged, gamy and anything but shy. A saturated palate borders on jammy, while this tastes of dark fruits, fine herbs and savory grilled beef. Meaty flavors and black fruit depth persist on a firm, compact finish. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Durigutti 2017 Proyecto Las Compuertas 1914 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: A saturated black color and reduced aromas of blackberry, cassis, black olive and asphalt gain more clarity with airing. On the palate, this is firm, grabby and fully extracted. Saturated berry flavors are dark as night, while this concrete-tank, high-elevation Malbec tastes mostly of ripe berry fruits on a seemingly never-ending finish. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Poligonos del Valle de Uco Gualtallary
Name: Zuccardi 2018 Poligonos del Valle de Uco Gualtallary Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: This Malbec from the Paraje Altamira section of the Uco Valley is a new member of the Luca lineup, and it more than holds its own. A generously oaked nose smells of earthy berry and black cherry along with graphite. A flush palate is well balanced, while this tastes of herbal plum and cassis backed by a touch of smoky oak. Fleshy berry flavors carry a plump and pulpy finish. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luca 2017 Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Description: This red delivers a full blast of berry fruit aromas along with savory notes of beef stew and fine herbs. Like the nose, this tastes herbal and savory. In terms of feel, it is solid in stature but brightened by bold acidity. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Zorzal 2017 Eggo Tinto de Tiza Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: A dark, dense color and bold berry aromas laced with tight-grained oak notes and related vanilla, spice and cinnamon accents are quite the draw. This full-flavored Malbec is medium in depth and driven by ripe fruit and wiry acidity. Blackberry, cassis and creamy, almost fatty oak flavors finish with medium length. Drink now through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luca 2017 Old Vine Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This Malbec from five different vineyard blocks is part of a small-batch project from brothers Hector and Pablo Durigutti. Pure aromas of blackberry and cassis come with an herbal accent. It is full in body but not heavy due to bracing acidity and controlled alcohol. Flavors of blackberry, plum and beetroot finish with clarity. Enjoy through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Durigutti 2018 Proyecto Las Compuertas Cinco Suelos Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a singular expression of the variety from a highly regarded vineyard. Blended with 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, plum, dark fruit, spice and dried herb aromas rise up from the glass. A richly flavorful, exquisitely balanced palate follows, with enough tannic structure to go the distance. It sails on the long, green tea and blue fruit-filled finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Charles & Charles 2016 C2 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Compact aromas of black plum, cassis and blackberry are reduced due to fermentation and aging in concrete, but with airing this Malbec opens like fan. A pure and juicy palate gets deeper and more layered with time in the glass. Plum, wild berry and savory flavors of wild herbs and stewed tomato finish with laser-like focus. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Zuccardi 2018 Concreto Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Description: Unusual aromas of blueberry and high-desert herbs require some getting used to. A dense, weighty palate is braced by lively acidity, while this Malbec from northerly Cafayate tastes exotic, with blueberry, wild blackberry and jammy plum flavors. Chalky tannins add refinement to an otherwise wild and jammy finish. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Matervini 2017 Alteza Malbec (Cafayate)

Description: This collective effort by the Michelini brothers stands out for its purity and especially its exotic aromas of spiced plum, hoison sauce, lavender, violet and sweet fennel. On the palate, this is narrow and acidic as it shows the essence of skin contact during winemaking, while minerally black plum and black cherry flavors are chalky like the label says. This is a terroir wine to the max, highly natural and marching to its own beat.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Calcáreo Granito de Tupungato Michelini Sammartino
Name: Superuco 2017 Calcáreo Granito de Tupungato Michelini Sammartino Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Toasty black fruit aromas are herbal but also lively. A lush and saturated palate is a true mouth filler, while this Malbec pumps out blackberry and crème de cassis flavors prior to a heady finish that comes up short on complexity and nuance. This is entirely about fruit, fruit and more fruit.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Colomé 2017 Estate Malbec (Salta)

Description: A deeply saturated black-meets-purple color and cool aromas of herbal blackberry, cola and minerals open this lush Malbec from Salta. A sappy palate is dense and full bodied, while this tastes of wild berry, cassis and balsamic reduction. A thick and sappy finish is fitting even though this sees no oak.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Colomé 2018 Auténtico Malbec (Salta)

Description: The nose of this single-vineyard wine is driven by aromas of black olive and ripe black fruit. The full palate is packed with a jammy blackberry flavor, while creamy notes of chocolate and vanilla transition to mocha on a lush finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: ZaHa 2018 Toko Vineyard Estate Grown Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Description: Herbal black fruit aromas come with strong accents of road tar and lemony oak. Size and power control the palate, which is saturated and extracted but not finessed. Jammy berry flavors come with an herbal note, while this Malbec from Cafayate is full on the finish but weighted down by drying tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Laborum Single Vineyard Finca Rio Seco
Name: El Porvenir 2017 Laborum Single Vineyard Finca Rio Seco Malbec (Cafayate)

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: This one-barrel project worked quite well in this vintage, starting with aromas of dried red and purple flowers and a black-raspberry-fruit component. There's more happening on the palate, where hickory and roasted cherry flavors meet with leather and savory teriyaki tones, wrapped in firm tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hawk Watch Winery 2016 Solo Barrique Malbec (South Coast)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earthy leather, tobacco and dried herb confront a midplate of thick black fruit in this well-balanced, exuberant wine. Sinewy, supple tannin structure gives it a framework that adds length and breath on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kokomo 2018 Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Herbal black fruit aromas are touched up by notes of earthy spice and cured meat. A prodding palate is both solid and tannic, while this Salta Malbec tastes of blackberry, dark plum, herbs and spices. A lush finish is equally stout, and overall you won't find much fault in this.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Amalaya 2018 Estate Malbec (Salta)

Description: Ripe blackberry aromas are reduced at first and then expand on a saturated nose. Ripeness continues on the palate, with flavors of lush berry fruits, cassis and chocolaty oak. While this is a bit heady and adheres to the familiar Mendoza style, it's a highly satisfying Malbec at a good price.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Fabre Montmayou 2018 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dark berry and black plum aromas come with subtle notes of juniper and sage brush. A layered but solid palate receives some acidic lift, while this tastes of berry fruits, plum, wood spice and chocolate. A smooth, mellow finish completes this balanced Malbec.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bernard Magrez 2018 La Bienvenida Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This natural-style Malbec is fermented with native yeast and aged entirely in concrete. It's lively on the nose in reedy wild berry and red currant aromas. The crisp, racy palate is jolting, while flavors of red plum, currant and cranberry lean spicy prior to a tight, focused finish. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Traslapiedra 2018 Vino de Desierto Marino Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's no question about the variety, with its opulent aromas of plum and blue fruits. Generous flavors follow, framed by pillowy, soft tannins, with plum, orange peel and herb notes lingering on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Waterbrook 2018 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This robust, softly textured wine is juicy in blue fruit, plum and chocolate, with firm, well-integrated tannins and toasted oak. It shows varietal character within a full-bodied, exuberant context of vibrant acidity and lasting freshness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kokomo 2017 Timber Crest Vineyard Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Just as in Bordeaux, Malbec in Margaret River is mostly blended away. It's fun, therefore, to see this variety both on its own and drinking so deliciously. It offers an appealing combo of red berries, earthy spices, cloves, licorice and cedar, all wrapped into savory, taut tannins.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Vinaceous 2017 Voodoo Moon Malbec (Margaret River)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Cool berry aromas include notes of brick dust and cola, while this feels fresh, pure and controlled. Blackberry, chocolate and coffee flavors hold form on a juicy finish that's balanced and full of energy.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Los Bocheros 2019 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Fennel and licorice aromas quickly give way to more dominant raspberry and black plum scents, while this feels plump, jammy and a touch soft on the palate. Grapy black fruit flavors are friendly, while this tastes of mulled blackberry on a ripe, easy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ricardo Santos 2018 La Madras Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Gritty dark-berry aromas come with a hint of road tar and asphalt. On the palate, this feels tight and fresh but linear rather than expansive. Blackberry, leather and tea flavors finish long and spicy, with chewy tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Norton 2018 Barrel Select Limited Edition Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Berry fruit aromas are gamy and a touch wild and unfocused, while this feels snappy and alert on the palate but also grating and amped up. Red plum, currant and wild berry flavors don't waiver on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Zorzal 2018 Terroir Único Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Sanguine and earthy, this wine is robustly red-fruited, with a smooth, simple structure of ample ripeness and power. A touch of black olive gives it a savory contrast to the midpalate richness, finishing simply.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Thirty-Seven 2016 Reserve Malbec (Sonoma County)

Description: The nose is fresh and brimming with plum, cherry and berry aromas. A flush palate is full and ripe, while this everyday Malbec from an excellent vintage tastes of herbal blackberry and light oak. What's best about this is that it doesn't push too hard; instead, it's balanced from head to toe.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca la Celia 2018 Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Reduced aromas of peanut and motor oil take the nose down a notch, while this feels clampy, condensed and compacted. Blackberry flavors are quite ripe but lacking in nuance, while this Malbec from a warm, copious vintage is monotone and jammy on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mendel 2018 Estate Grown & Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Roasted, blackened berry aromas are gamy and herbal and suggest hot blacktop. On the palate, this Cafayate Malbec is tight and gritty in feel. Oaky berry and plum flavors are herbal and buttery, while the tannins are hard on a finish with a green note.                      Michael Schachner
Name: El Porvenir 2018 Amauta Absoluto Malbec (Cafayate)

Description: Full of soft supple red fruit, this full-bodied wine is firm in tannin and oak, with a lasting tanginess of red currant, orange and cedar.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hans Fahden 2016 Shayna Vista Vineyard Malbec (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Sanguine, earthy and aromatic in lavender, this wine invites one in, providing a soft, supple palate of thick, plummy blue fruit and dried herb. It offers approachability and full-bodied ripeness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2016 After Midnight Malbec (Oak Knoll District)

Description: This is a robustly powerful and deeply ripe wine, blended with small amounts of Petit Verdot and Merlot and given 14 months in French oak. Plummy, perfumed and grippy in oak and tannin, it has a softness to the finish, veering into a taste of bitter chocolate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: V. Sattui 2017 Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A very earthy expression of this grape, this bottling begins with aromas of potting soil and crushed rocks as well as leather and slightly sour fruit. The palate offers a tarry earth and drying plum flavor profile.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Odonata 2017 Pedregal Vineyard Malbec (San Benito County)

Description: Dry citrus aromas are clean but limited, while this feels plump and generally fresh, with medium-level acidity. A pleasing mix of orange, nectarine and melon flavors is lightly salty, while a steady finish guards those same flavor notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodini 2019 Rosé of Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dusty overtones are on top of raspberry jam and plum aromas. On the palate, this Malbec is tannic and grating. Intense plum and berry flavors show a natural smokiness, while this widens out and feels jammy on a saturated finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2018 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Horsey aromas lack finesse, while this Malbec is huge and sappy on the palate, with a resiny oak-driven feel. Plum flavors are covered in oak, while this tastes of saucy plum and green herbs on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Single Vineyard La Pampa Estate Plot N°21
Name: Salentein 2016 Single Vineyard La Pampa Estate Plot N°21 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, baking spice, plum and cherry Luden's cough drops lead to soft, fleshy herb and cherry flavors that are light in the middle. It has an appealing mouthfeel.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Waterbrook 2017 Reserve Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Leathery berry, olive and molasses aromas make for a fairly full and generous start. A plump palate fills out and shows better structure as this sits, while plum flavors give way to spice notes on the backside.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Budeguer 2016 4000 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel aromas of vanilla, wood and nougat are in the lead, with cherry notes following. Plentiful fruit and barrel flavors follow. The oak seems heavy-handed for the fruit that's in the glass.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Columbia Winery 2017 Malbec (Red Mountain)

Description: Clove and berry aromas yield to lactic chocolaty notes on an oaky nose, while this feels flush and fleshy. Full plum and berry flavors are heavily oaked, resulting in clove, vanilla and other spicy-creamy flavors on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca La Anita 2018 Luna Single Vineyard Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: Concentrated black fruit aromas show notes of tar and black olive. On the palate, this Malbec is full and fleshy, with prodding acidity. Dark berry, cinnamon and mild chocolate flavors finish with peppery spice, oak notes and healthy acidity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: François Lurton 2019 Bodega Piedra Negra Alta Colección Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of tire rubber, olive, black fruits and oak cover the bases, while this Malbec feels a bit sticky and grabby, with hard tannins. Oak-driven herbal blackberry flavors finish full and grapy.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ruta 22 2018 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are unusual, with notes of pine resin, violet, soil and dates. The palate shows more of the same, along with a fair amount of astringency and some bitterness to the tannins.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Three Rivers 2017 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Mature berry aromas are slightly baked and beefy, while this feels tight and tartaric. Lemony acidity perks up plum and berry flavors but dilutes concentration on a racy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Argenses 2016 Reserve Block #15 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of earthy black fruits, iodine and mushroom lead to an extracted palate that's sappy and sinewy. Salty berry flavors are spicy but heavily oaked, and thus mint and clove are part of the flavor picture. On the finish, this Malbec is grapy, oaky and flush.                      Michael Schachner
Name: La Posta 2018 Paulucci Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Berry fruit aromas come with notes of cinnamon and tire rubber, while this feels flush and fleshy. Berry and black currant flavors are lightly spiced with cinnamon, while this tastes vaguely of oak and coffee on a jammy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Flichman 2019 Misterio Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A black color and heavy, earthy aromas of murky blackberry, stewed fruit and oak suggest a wine that's a touch overripe. On the palate, this feels extracted and tannic. Reduced flavors of baked berry fruits and oak finish flush, full and tannic.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Norton 2018 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy plum and blackberry aromas are ripe and wild, with cola and herbal undertones. A jammy, saturated palate is lusty but loose, while plum, stewed blueberry and herbal green notes share the flavor profile.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domingo Molina 2016 Hermanos Valles Calchaquíes Malbec (Salta)

Description: Rooty aromas of licorice and grass include notes of amaro and lemon peel. This is juicy but incomplete feeling, with saucy red berry flavors backed up by herbal notes. A sappy, raw finish ends this unconventional low-alcohol (13%) Malbec.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viejo Isaias 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dusty, chalky aromas are attached to berry fruit scents, while this feels tight and juicy but limited in scope and complexity. Red berry and plum flavors are saucy and spicy, while acidity and rubbery tannins combine forces on a hard-driving finish.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Made with Organic Grapes Hand Harvested Grapes
Name: Santa Julia 2019 Made with Organic Grapes Hand Harvested Grapes Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Blackberry, cassis, vanilla and chocolate aromas feed into palate with rubbery tannins and a creamy overall texture driven by oak. Forceful oaky flavors infuse confected vanilla and chocolate notes into a creamy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Lexicon 2018 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Cassis and plum aromas come with a sweet dash of cinnamon that seems a bit fake but not off-putting. A rubbing palate is slightly tannic, while this tastes of foxy berry fruit and metal. A lightly herbal finish with mild green notes is the close.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Chacabuco 2019 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Milk chocolate and vanilla aromas are matched to ripe, fat berry scents. On the palate, this is lacking in structure and shape but offers lots of volume. Creamy oak and related vanilla flavors overshadow plum and berry flavors, while this sends up more of the same on an oaky finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Somewhere Else 2017 Malbec (Tulum Valley)

Description: Plum and berry aromas are common for basic Argentine Malbec, while this feels wiry and juicy. Raw, slightly salty plum and red berry flavors show a hint of sauciness and vanilla on a bright finish. Only 10% of this wine passed through oak.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Enrique Foster 2018 Ique Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Floral aromas of raspberry, currant and lemon peel feed into a tight, acidic palate with minimal body. Plum and cassis flavors are better at first, then lightly oxidized on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca La Escondida 2018 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Raw, reedy aromas of plum and raspberry are slightly grassy and a touch green. This Malbec feels sharp on the surface, with modest depth. Cranberry, currant and a touch of weedy green make up the flavors on this tomatoey wine.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tercos 2018 Malbec (Mendoza)
