Description: Candied aromas come across on the nose. Mild spritz and candied, yeasty flavors define the palate, while this tastes sweet and feels slightly cloying on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Nampe 2019 Natural Expression Rosado de Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Superconcentrated and absolutely brimming with ripe fruit, this full-bodied wine is impressive all the way through. A deep, dark color leads to rich fruit and dark-chocolate flavors and melted tannins that make the texture velvety.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2017 Malbec (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are arresting, with achingly pure notes of dark plum, boysenberry, dried herb and black pepper. The palate is elegant and shows a dazzling sense of purity, deftness, nuance and balance, with enough acidity and tannin structure to do well with a bit of time in the cellar. Offerings like this from this producer are redefining what Washington wine is all about. Make sure to pair it with food, perhaps a grilled pork chop with a cherry reduction.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2017 Boushey Vineyard Côt (Yakima Valley)

Description: Ripe berry and vanilla aromas are earthy, creamy and inviting, while this Maule Malbec exhibits a bold palate with tannic grip. Spicy oak and natural darkness back up robust plum and cassis flavors, while this is steady on the finish, with juicy acidity maintaining brightness.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casa Donoso 2018 Bicentenario Gran Reserva Malbec (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Macerated strawberries, grenadine and light red-licorice aromas are fresh on the nose of this bottling. It lands on the palate with riper flavors of strawberry sorbet and red cherry, which are enhanced by cardamom and anise spices, making for a very drinkable experience.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wilson Creek 2016 Matriarch Vineyard Malbec (Temecula Valley)

Description: Made entirely with Malbec, this has aromas suggesting violet, leather and graphite. The juicy palate offers dried black cherry, cocoa and vanilla alongside velvety tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria Aldobrandesca 2017 Vie Cave Malbec (Toscana)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is very ripe, almost like a dessert wine, but dry, offering tons of black-plum, dried cherry, black-fig and blackberry flavors on a broad, soothing, lightly tannic texture. It's an unusual and delicious wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mineral Wines 2017 Malbec (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smashed blackberry aromas meet with grape seed and wet earth on the nose of this bottling, which still has lingering primary fermentation elements. The palate is more rich and resolved, with black-currant paste and caramel-laced-pastry flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hearst Ranch 2017 Babicora Malbec (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, well-balanced wine tastes fruity and fresh, even though it is firmly tannic. It offers light black-pepper and wood smoke accents to add some complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Writer's Block 2017 Malbec (Lake County)

Description: Loud berry aromas are spicy and a touch green, with a vanilla-oak offset, while a juicy, narrow palate is high in energy and loaded with cranberry, plum and cherry flavors. Complexity isn't a big part of this bright Malbec.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vistamar 2018 Sepia Reserva Malbec (Maule Valley)

Description: Floral plum and berry aromas come with notes of cotton candy and animal fur. A bright and lively palate is ramped up with red berry flavors, green notes and saucy accents, while this Malbec is smacking but fresh on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Chilensis 2018 Reserva Estate Bottled Malbec (Maule Valley)

Description: Gamy aromas of plum and berry include a note of olive. A sappy palate shows good balance and a mix of creamy depth and tannins, while this tastes of foxy berry fruits and lightly candied oak.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Original House Wine NV Malbec (Central Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of maraschino cherry, red apple, dark fruit, nail polish and spice are followed by evolved flavors. It seems to have seen some oxygen in barrel.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: T2 2016 Reserve Gamache Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Wet rock and dusty gravel minerality kick off the nose of this bottling, which offers deep, dark fruit behind that stony impression. There is a rich black-cherry flavor on the front of the palate, as well as a minty kick, and it carries into a comforting and full finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Opaque 2016 Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: The top wine in the Eugénie collection, this is made from a selection of the best parcels. Almost black in color, it is perfumed from the new wood as well as the dense fruits. The powerful structure is beginning to bring out the fruits and acidity, promising an excellent wine from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Eugénie 2016 Haute Collection  (Cahors)

Description: This wine from the Fournié family is made from organically grown grapes. Its powerful structure, impressively fine tannins and black fruits are coming together in a wine that has density and spicy, perfumed concentration. It will age further, so drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2016 Prestige  (Cahors)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Full aromas of cherry, fennel and wild thyme invite the nose into this lush and expressive bottling by Damian Doffo and family. A tightly woven, rocky structure and fresh acidity holds together roasted strawberry and white-pepper flavors, leading into a vanilla finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Doffo 2014 Private Reserve Malbec (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: All estate fruit, pure varietal blend and a deep purple-black hue, this tightly wound Malbec is dense with concentrated raspberry purée fruit. Accents of toast, vanilla and lightly roasted walnuts suggest more complexity within. At the moment this drinks like a very young, very good Zinfandel, and it should develop beautifully in the bottle. Drink now–2030.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abacela 2016 Malbec (Umpqua Valley)

Description: This 29-acre vineyard has delivered an impressively mature wine. Rich tannins have moved into the black fruits that are now showing spice, licorice and minerality. This well-structured wine is now ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2014 Domaine du Théron Grande Réserve  (Cahors)

Description: Ripe, chunky black-fruit aromas are swathed in minty oak and vanilla, while accents of black olive and prune are part of the nose. A round, full palate is enlivened by tartaric kick before going quiet, while ripe berry, prune and cassis flavors finish flat and dense. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2015 Single Vineyard Las Compuertas Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A deep, dense take on a single-vineyard, single-grape expression, this is packed with ripe blueberry and black cherry fruit. Highlights of white pepper and other spices, along with finishing flavors of chamomile tea, add further interest. This lovely and balanced wine should be enjoyed over the next five years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2016 Crater View Vineyard Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Description: A deep-purple color sets up grapey, slightly reduced blackberry aromas that are forceful but not nuanced. The same can be said for a flush palate that's full of exotic berry, spicy oak and cassis flavors. On the finish, this bullish Malbec remains lusty and fruit-packed; drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Amorio A Blend of Malbecs Paraje Altamira
Name: Tikal 2015 Amorio A Blend of Malbecs Paraje Altamira Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This very clearly reflects the estate's style and fondness for black-fruited, almost impenetrably dark, smoky, meaty, full-throttle red wines. It's more Abacela and less varietal in terms of flavors, which isn't at all bad. The dark berry fruits are lofted with smoke and baking spices, and this reserve block selection is ready to enjoy.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abacela 2015 East Hill Block Reserve Malbec (Umpqua Valley)

Description: A saturated dark-purple color and heady aromas of raisin and blackberry push this Malbec to the cusp of overripe. Sappy extraction means the palate feel is heavy, while jammy blackberry and prune flavors are a throwback to 15 years ago, when size and ripeness dominated the Malbec scene in Argentina. While this is fleshy and big on the finish, elegance is not part of the formula. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Infinito 2015 Winemaker's Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A dark-purple color and bright plum and cassis aromas, with a note of iodine, open this sappy, tannic, grapey Malbec. Deep plum and cassis flavors are gamy and foxy, while rubbing tannins make a fleshy finish feel grabby. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casa Natal 2015 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Ripened a bit less than the 2016, this nonetheless strikes a balanced chord with spicy pomegranate fruit matched to a mix of herb and stem accents. The tannins turn astringent, with a touch of peat moss on the nose and the trailing finish. The texture and length are a plus.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Reustle 2017 Estate Selection Malbec (Umpqua Valley)

Description: This wine, 100% Malbec, is part of a series of bottlings from this producer that highlight southwest France appellations. This firm and structured wine balances solid tannins with rich black plum-skin flavors and layers of spice. Drink the wine from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Bernard Magrez 2017 Première  (Cahors)

Description: The wood aging of this mature wine has helped develop the black fruits and rich structure. Smoky and spicy, the wine has touches of coffee and firm tannins that give the a core of dryness, with a light touch of freshness at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2014 Château du Port Grande Réserve  (Cahors)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Clean lines of blackberry, black pepper, crumpled rose and carnation show on the nose of this bottling. Firm tannins frame the rich, dark red fruits, that are wrapped in a leathery frame, with hints of dried meat and more red flowers.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Doffo 2017 Malbec (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The aromas jump out of the glass, with notes of bright raspberry, fresh red currant, orange rind, a sprinkling of savory herb and a whiff of mesquite. The palate is flavorful and juicy, chock-full of red fruit flavors, with blood orange notes on the finish. It displays a pleasing sense of elegance—an intriguing offering of this variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Catman 2017 Malbec (Columbia Valley (OR))

Description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this wine has an impressive structure, with bold tannins that support succulent black fruits. Dense and concentrated from both the texture and the fruits, this wine will age well. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2018 L'Envie Vin Naturel  (Cahors)

Description: Earthy berry aromas are outmatched by resiny oak on a nose that offers stalky fruit, wood grain, clove and asphalt scents. An edgy palate feels resiny, while this mostly deals flavors of wood and oak spice. Dry tannins and oak-based clove and cardamom leftovers control the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: M The Marshall Reserva Single Vineyard Old Vines
Name: Bodega Goulart 2015 M The Marshall Reserva Single Vineyard Old Vines Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Neutral aromas are capped with crusty berry darkness. Juicy acidity and skins-driven tannins make for a rough palate, while plum and red-berry flavors are mostly pure and free of oak. A fresh finish wraps up this high-energy Malbec.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bressia 2017 Sylvestra Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: “Now or never” is the name of this wine. It certainly demands attention with its fine tannins and rich black fruits. The wine's solid character, packed with Malbec's spice and dry core, will ensure that it ages. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ponzac 2018 Maintenant ou Jamais  (Cahors)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas intrigue, with notes of flower, orange oil, evergreen and asphalt. A medium-bodied palate follows, full of somewhat lighter orange peel flavors. Grapefruit notes linger on the finish. It's interesting, but the fruit doesn't seem to have fully ripened.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Ott & Hunter 2016 Boushey Vineyard Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied black raspberry, licorice, Dr Pepper and strong, dewy herb aromas play loudly on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also overloaded with minty herbs of sage, thyme and marjoram, which give refreshing intrigue to the bright plummy fruit core.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Counter Punch 2017 Malbec (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: In this vintage, the blend includes 8% Cabernet Franc, which puts strength to strength as far as which red grapes are proving to do well in southern Oregon. It's firm and tannic, but with solid cassis and black cherry fruit that displays the structure to age. A hint of dark chocolate threads through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Season 2015 Malbec (Southern Oregon)

Description: The Cahors vineyards occupy a series of terraces rising from the river Lot. This wine comes from the third terrace up and has the proper structure. It is still fresh and shows tannins although everything is maturing. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Château du Port Elegance des Terrasses
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2016 Château du Port Elegance des Terrasses  (Cahors)

Description: A blend from Malbec vineyards from across the region around Cahors, this wine has structure and ripe blackberry flavors. The tannins and the young fruit are working towards a softer aspect that will emerge over the next few months. Drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2018 Pyrène L'Irrésistible Magie Noire Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Description: Plum and berry aromas are harsh at first, then more true with airing. A rubbery palate borders on astringent, while plum, prune and blackberry flavors finish abruptly due to dry tannins. This is a more honest and clean Malbec than prior years when this wine smelled and tasted overworked and too much like its name.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Layer Cake 2017 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A flat nose is a touch more soupy, meaty and earthy than bright and fruity. Grabby tannins weigh down a palate with plum and berry flavors, while this Malbec shows a mild stewed note on the finish. Tasted twice with inconsistent results.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Flichman 2017 Misterio Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Inky, grapy aromas never get away from seeming murky, while this also smells woody and like pencil lead. A sappy palate is not in the best shape, while this is loud in berry flavors but short on nuance and elegance. Olive, prune and coffee flavors share the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Salentein 2017 Killka Collection Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Initially this smells soapy and artificial, and after that, the nose falls apart. A condensed, syrupy mouthfeel lacks flow, while this tastes medicinal and dark, with a green hint to forced-toast and black-fruit flavors.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Iaccarini 2017 Viablanca Terroir Series Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: With a touch of reduction on the nose, this is a memorable, complex and intensely powerful wine that impresses from start to finish. Turned earth, pencil shavings, graphite and black currant combine around cut herbs. The well-mannered tannins will mellow further in time. Enjoy 2026–2031.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Devil Proof 2016 Rockpile Ridge Malbec (Rockpile)

Description: Black truffle, tar and black licorice combine around thick, rich layers in this gorgeous, structured and full-bodied wine. Earthy and herbal, it shines in its balance of complementary characteristics.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Devil Proof 2016 Farrow Ranch Malbec (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Diamond Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: A pure 100% expression of the grape from the producer's estate, this wine is brawny in black fruit, leather and bittersweet chocolate. Offering length and breadth, it is soft, well-integrated and chalky in tannin, with a lasting note of dried herb and tobacco.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Davies 2016 J. Davies Estate Malbec (Diamond Mountain District)

Description: Pungent earth and compost underlie high-toned blue fruit and black currant in this soft, rounded and full-bodied wine. Seamless tannins find complementary oak, allowing room for the fruit to sing.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vine Cliff 2016 Malbec (Oakville)

Description: An entirely 100% varietal wine, this shows a touch of menthol and resin on the nose, an intensity that settles in the glass to unfurl slowly into a concentrated layering of broad black fruit, gunpowder and oak. The finish is a mix of black pepper and sinewy leather.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Baldassari 2017 Asti Ranch Malbec (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of tar, dark plum and aniseed intrigue. A full-flavored palate with soft tannins follow.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Latta 2016 Weinbau Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Leathery, spicy and brimming in blueberry, clove and oak, this is a robust, full-bodied and concentrated wine that's soft and smooth on the palate. Its intensity satisfies and finds balance in an enduring brightness on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: William Hill Estate 2015 Winemaker's Series Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dried herb, coffee, graphite, tomato leaf, sweet barrel spice and cherry aromas lead to fruit and barrel flavors that display a sense of elegance, with the tannins giving a squeeze. Coffee notes linger on the finish. It's tasty, though the variety seems hard to find. Give the tannins some time to settle in.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dusted Valley 2016 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Orange oil, raspberry and herb aromas are followed by lighter-styled orange peel flavors with a slightly tacky feel that softens over time. It's an unusual offering of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kerloo 2017 Stone Tree Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is generous, ripe and structured, wrapping firm fine-grained tannins around ripe blueberry, dark chocolate and blackberry flavors that are deep and broad. Best through 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Miraflores 2016 Estate Malbec (El Dorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated aromas of black currant, violet, lilac and oak arise on the nose of this bottling. The palate is rich, plush and ripe in a black cherry flavor, yet also cut by pleasing acidity and firm tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Graveyard 2016 Malbec (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All the fruit for this wine comes from Stillwater Creek Vineyard on the Royal Slope. Barrel aromas are out front, with notes of cocoa, mint, flowers, plum, asphalt, green wood and blackberry. The palate is soft and textured, showing pleasing complexities on the finish. The wood shows a bit prominently at present, but there's a lot behind it.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Tenor 2016 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From Happy Canyon Vineyards, this bottling starts with soft aroma of ripe dark cherry as well as lavender and black-pepper dust. The palate shows roasted cherry, red flower petals and stewed plum flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rideau 2016 Siempre Malbec (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Tempting, perfumed oak and cedar notes light up the aroma of this full-bodied wine, and meld with bold, ripe and powerful black-fruit flavors on the palate. Firm tannins and a touch of lively acidity give it good structure. Best from 2022.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Minus Tide 2015 Alder Springs Vineyard Malbec (Mendocino)

Description: Stalky berry, tomato and herbal aromas open this wet-vintage Malbec. On the palate, this is full and borderline syrupy. Candied, lightly baked berry and tomato flavors are sappy on a hot finish that never fully sheds its awkwardness.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Polkura 2016 Malbec (Marchigue)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Violet candies, turned earth, tobacco leaf and grape-seed aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the McGinley Vineyard. There are strong tobacco-leaf flavors on the palate alongside dank herbs and tangy black plum.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rideau 2016 The Brassman Malbec (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Gritty berry aromas are a bit roasted, while this Malbec from Colchagua is full, dense and chewy in feel. Herbal, spicy plum and berry flavors come from the dark side, while this tastes mildly green on the finish, with bell pepper notes branded into fuller berry fruit flavors.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Tinguiririca
Name: Concha y Toro 2017 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Tinguiririca Malbec (Marchigue)

Description: Medicinal cherry and berry aromas come with an oaky note of latex. This Maule Malbec feels grabby and smacking, while herbal berry flavors include some green. On the finish, oak-driven clove notes rise up while the feel is raw and a bit hollow.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Altamana 2017 Grande Reserve Malbec (Maule Valley)

Description: This full-bodied deep-colored wine offers earth and dried herb aromas, good blackberry and wood-smoke flavors and a touch of tannin to build the texture. No sulfites added.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2018 Organic Malbec (Mendocino)

Description: Floral citric aromas are lean and minerally, while this Malbec from near the Pacific Ocean feels airy and less than concentrated. Herbal red fruit flavors are fresh and popping, while this finishes with minty spice notes and not much heft.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Aresti 2017 Trisquel Series Curicó Costa Malbec (Curicó Valley)

Description: A grape jam aroma and flavor gives this wine an easy, approachable style. It feels soft in texture and ends ripe and fruity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Barefoot NV Malbec (California)

Description: Stalky aromas of briny berry and plum lack the full richness and ripeness that Malbec is known for. In the mouth, this is sticky, choppy and tannic. Dry, spicy berry flavors are generic except for woody clove notes, while on the finish this is minty tasting and rough in feel.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Calcu 2016 Reserva Especial Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Herbaceous berry aromas include notes of pyrazines and eucalyptus. This Malbec is lean and tight on a tomatoey palate, while minty, herbal plum and berry flavors are savory in front of a lightly green finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Sierra Batuco 2017 Reserva Estate Bottled Malbec (Maule Valley)

Description: Great midtier value is found in this full-force Malbec from a powerful vintage. A blueberry pie aroma is ripe to the max, alongside a whiff of graphite. The fully extracted palate bursts with cassis and berry flavors, while the more this breathes, the less heavy it seems. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mendel 2017 Estate Grown & Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: The magnum format seems to be in vogue again, even better if your big bottle is filled with something as nice as this Malbec from Laura Catena. Dark berry, blueberry, leather and smoky aromas set up a palate that's saturated and a touch fiery with acid. Toasty blackberry and coffee flavors are primary and finish dark and steady. This is from a lusty vintage. Enjoy through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luca 2017 Historia de Familia Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A pitch-black color and initially reduced aromas of cassis, blackberry, damp forest floor and olive form a burly start to this flush Malbec built on rubbery tannins. Saturated black-fruit flavors push the meter, while this remains tight, loaded and powerful to the end. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Norton 2017 Altura Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A nose brimming with cassis, mocha and toast leads straight to a fruit explosion on the palate. Dark, spicy berry flavors blow up then spread out on a finish that sizzles with latent acidity. This is a bowling ball of a Malbec from old vines in La Consulta. Best from 2020–2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Altocedro 2017 Reserva La Consulta Vineyards Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: A full-force, aromatic shot of oak and potent black fruit carries the nose of this wine. The full palate features a rich blackberry flavor prior to the narrow, toasty finish. It carries all the power of the 2017 vintage. Drink through 2029.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bianchi 2017 Particular Family Estate Grown Malbec

Description: Blackberry aromas are supported by notes of cool earth and forest floor. A full palate is pretty tough and demanding due to smacking tannins, while this Malbec sees dark-fruit flavors backed by toasty spice. On the finish, this remains a bit fiery and tartaric.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Benegas 2015 Arraigo Benegas Estate Single Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Red-berry aromas suggest raspberry and plum, and there's a slight hint of raspy green to boot. A fresh and racy palate shows bold plum-based acidity and gritty tannins. Plum and wild berry are the key flavors that wrap up on a dry and edgy finish with hard tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Benegas 2015 Arraigo Benegas Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Saucy berry aromas are slightly herbal and include an earthy note of brick dust. This Malbec feels sappy and full. Dark berry flavors show a hint of prune and desiccation, while this simmers with full berry flavors and spice notes on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Santa Julia 2018 Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Ripe cherry and dark-berry aromas meld with light tobacco and crushed pepper on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is tart and juicy, yet filled out nicely by cranberry and blackberry flavors. The tannins are lightly grippy, with acidity being the main driver.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2014 Estate Bottled Malbec (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Wintergreen notes ride shotgun to stripped cherry and cough drop scents. This is racy and high in acidity, with little cushion or body. Flavors of plum skins and cherry are lightly oaked in front of a finish that's dry as a bone.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Alfredo Roca 2015 Reserva de Familia Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A dark color and pounding aromas of hot stones, leather, herbal plum and currant get this organic-grape Malbec started. In the mouth, this is thick and jammy. Herbal plum, baked berry, vanilla and green notes comprise the flavors, while this is grabby and a bit sticky on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tapiz 2018 T Made with Organic Grapes Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Plum, berry and cassis aromas are a touch stalky. On the palate, this feels smacking and tomatoey, with punchy acidity raising the liveliness level. Spicy, slightly green-plum and berry flavors finish with a touch of oxidation.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Areyna 2018 Estate Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Stalky berry aromas are topped with a chemical oak note. A tight palate is firmed up by grabby tannins, while flavors of berry fruits, mint, green herbs and oaky graphite are a bit hot on a finish, with minty green undertones.                      Michael Schachner
Name: TintoNegro 2018 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Jumbled aromas of tomato sauce, green herbs and mild oxidation lead to a heavy palate. Jammy berry flavors seem a bit overripe, while this is sluggish on a finish that's lacking in flow.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled
Name: Zolo 2018 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Jumpy berry aromas are young and wild, while this feels big and plummy in the mouth. Foxy berry flavors show some forced oak and a hint of chocolate, then a hot finish marks the close.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2018 Camila Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Forced oak aromas create a sense of char and pasty vanilla on the nose. A rubbery palate is lively and not flabby, while woody flavors of campfire and stewed plum finish up this wine.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Kaiken 2018 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A roasted plum aroma melds with lots of herbs on the nose. A wide and tannic palate feels blocky and rough, while this Malbec from Cafayate in the north tastes mulchy more than fruity and bright. Not bad, but it's a challenge.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Altocedro 2015 Abras Malbec (Cafayate)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Aromas of mint gumdrop and green herbs shield shy berry scents. This is high in acid, modest in body and short on palate appeal. Salty flavors of plum skins finish short.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cigar Box 2018 Old Vine Hand Harvested Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Stocky berry aromas are mildly spicy but struggle to stay fresh and vital. This Malbec is rubbery and tannic in feel, with baked berry and prune flavors. Residual tannins on the finish are drying.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodini 2018 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy aromas are low on fruit, with a hint of cinnamon. A narrow, acidic palate deals salty red-fruit flavors. Beyond that, there's little more to describe.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mendoza Vineyards 2018 Clos de Mendoza Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: The top wine from this always-impressive estate delivers dense fruit and concentration, but that's just one aspect. The other is the style and elegance of a wine that has both power and restraint. Black fruits shine here, balanced by acidity and with the still-young dryness of tannins giving it potential. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Cèdre 2016 Cuvée GC  (Cahors)

Description: This top wine from an organically run estate is powerful. Black fruits aged in new wood have a perfumed, spicy character as well as layers of toastiness. The rich, complex texture of the wine, with minerality contrasting the sweet berry flavors, sets it up for aging. A Fournié family wine, it will be ready from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2016 Pur Plaisir  (Cahors)

Description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this powerful wine is a magnificent explosion of black Malbec tannins and fruits. Its ripe structure and density are nowhere near maturity but have great potential. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Cèdre 2016 Le Cèdre  (Cahors)

Description: Named after the owner of this estate in the 15th century, this wine is structured and ripe. It is also balanced with black-plum fruits, touches of mint and toast from wood aging. The wine could do with more aging and will be better from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Château de Haute-Serre Cuvée Géron Dadine
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Château de Haute-Serre Cuvée Géron Dadine  (Cahors)

Description: Deep and almost black in color, this wine brings out plenty of powerful, solid tannins as well as black-plum flavors. The wine is still tough, still developing, with a dry core that needs to soften. Drink this concentrated wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ponzac 2016 La Temperadou  (Cahors)

Description: Produced from a selection of parcels, this wine comes from the showpiece estate of Cayx that has connections with the Danish royal family. After four years its tannins are well integrated into the ripe black-plum flavors and the acidity that gives freshness. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Cayx 2015  Cahors

Description: This wine's immense alcohol is striking by its absence on the palate. It is certainly big but the black fruits, acidity and solid tannins are balanced, giving a wine with firm, young tannins and plenty of aging potential. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Cuvée Dame Honneur du Château Lagrézette
Name: Château Lagrézette 2016 Cuvée Dame Honneur du Château Lagrézette  (Cahors)

Description: Top of the range from this producer, this wine was matured in new wood that has added to the tannins of the fruit and given a minty aroma and flavor. The wine also has plenty of blackberry fruit so everything will come into focus and balance as it develops. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lamartine 2016 Expression  (Cahors)

Description: Powerfully ripe, this dense wine is full of black fruits and concentrated tannins. Power comes from the solid structure that is leavened by acidity. Wood aging has enhanced the weight of the wine. It is still young and will be ready to drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lagrézette 2016 Cuvée Marguerite Massaut  (Cahors)

Description: Full of black fruits, this wine has structure, density and concentration. At the same time, it shows restraint and even elegance, giving a poised statement of Malbec. Juicy acidity at the end adds freshness. Drink the wine from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Château de Haute-Serre  (Cahors)

Description: Fermented and aged in an oval-shaped tank, this wine is very young, packed with black fruits and still dominated by tannins. A dense expression of Malbec from old vines, it has a spicy character. Drink this wine from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Gaudou 2018 Le Sang de Ma Terre  (Cahors)

Description: The main estate wine from this property, this offers ripe red fruits, a dense texture and lots of solid tannins. It is balanced and firm, while showing great fruitiness for the future. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lagrézette 2016  Cahors

Description: Perfumed with new wood and spice as well as black fruits, this ripe wine hints at mint flavors from the wood aging. Well balanced between black-currant flavors and dense tannins, this estate wine is almost ready to drink. Wait until 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Château Pech de Jammes  (Cahors)

Description: Hand-picked from six acres surrounding a 17th-century dovecote perched above the vines, this wine is massive—Malbec on steroids. Nearly two years in wood have added intense dryness to the wine that needs time to soften. Concentration and dense black fruits and tannins give the wine a medicinal character. It will not be ready until at least 2025.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lagrézette 2016 Le Pigeonnier  (Cahors)

Description: This dense, ripe Malbec boasts solid tannins and spice from wood aging. Big, bold and powerful, it has structure to balance the black fruits and acidity. Even at four years of age it has potential to mature further. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Mas des Etoiles 2015  Cahors

Description: Everything is extreme about this limited-production wine including the formidably heavy bottle. The wine makes a statement with superripe black fruits, rich tannins and density. Aged for 20 months in new wood it conveys considerable power as well as alcohol. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lagrézette 2016 Paragon  (Cahors)

Description: Still very young, this perfumed wine is rich with tannins and black fruits. Its concentration is impressive, bringing the ripe fruits firmly into the structure and dry core of the wine. All it needs is time, so wait to drink until 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vincens 2016 Origine  (Cahors)

Description: The chalky third terrace of the four hillside Cahors vineyard levels has produced a wine that is smooth and ripe, rounded with integrated tannins and great black fruits. The wine is just reaching drinkability although it will be even better from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Saint-Sernin 2015 de Calcaire  (Cahors)

Description: This wine is all about ripe black fruits. The 15% Merlot in the blend softens the Malbec tannins without diluting the juicy black fruits and structure. Still a little young the wine will be better from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lamartine 2016 Prestige du  (Cahors)

Description: A richly structured wine, this has firm tannins and bold, ripe blackberry fruits. Its dry core is still present, suggesting the wine could age. It certainly has concentration. It should be best from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ponzac 2016 Les Peyrières Rives d'Olt  (Cahors)

Appellation: Ramona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: A strong and balanced showing from a vineyard near San Diego, this bottling blends accessible red-fruit aromas with rugged earth tones of dust and pencil shavings on the nose. The palate is rustic and pleasing, with blackberry, oregano and more dried earth flavors—a worthy competitor to more established regions to the north.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Chuparosa 2015 Malbec (Ramona Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are expressive, with notes of coconut shavings, dark plum, coffee, vanilla and cocoa. Rich, full-bodied, layered dark-fruit and barrel flavors follow, packing a big punch. Vanilla notes linger on the finish. Fruit and barrel play equal parts in this compelling show.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Fielding Hills 2016 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark berries, crushed gravel and muddy clay make for a rustic but compelling nose on this bottling from a warm valley. It's tightly wound on the palate, where a chalky mouthfeel delivers bright blackberry and red-currant flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Galante 2014 Ace High Malbec (Carmel Valley)

Description: A densely structured wine, this is full both of tannins and ripe black-plum fruits. Aged for a year in wood, it has a spiciness that enhances the flavors. The wine's future is assured and it will be better from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lagrézette 2017 Chevalier du Château Lagrézette  (Cahors)

Description: A complex series of tannins and black-plum fruits give this powerful wine a firm structure and solid texture. With its richness, ripe fruits and density, this wine will still age. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Famaey 2016 Prestige  (Cahors)

Description: A big, ripe wine with dense black fruits, this bottling celebrates the two regions of the world where Malbec reigns: Cahors in France and Mendoza in Argentina. The tannins of Cahors have been smoothed in the spirit of Mendoza, a winning, attractive combination. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Antisto Tradition  (Cahors)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Whereas most of the fruit from this variety and vineyard was bottled young and released early, five barrels that make up this wine received additional élevage. Vibrant, fruit-forward aromas of raspberry, cherry, thistle, farmyard and cranberry lead to tart, tangy red-fruit flavors. As always with the wines from this producer, it's best suited for the dinner table.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2016 Dépendant Red Wine Dineen Vineyard Côt (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: Equally full of fruit and acidity, this wine has a solid structure. Black-currant flavors are supported by the dense tannic texture. All this means the wine needs time, and will be best from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Gaudou 2017 Renaissance  (Cahors)

Description: Beautifully structured, this is an impressive evocation of Malbec. Its firm tannin character is still solidly in place, although the wine also shows freshness from blackberry fruits. Aged for two years in wood, the wine is developing well, although it's not ready. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Famaey 2016 Cuvée X  (Cahors)

Description: With a bright dark-purple color, this is still a young wine. That's confirmed by the bold black fruit, great freshness and acidity that shine, backed by a core of dryness from tannins. The wine will age; drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos d'Audhuy 2016  Cahors

Description: The three years aging has smoothed out this rich wine and revealed generous tannins, ripe blackberry flavors and attractive acidity. Let the bold fruit soften and drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ponzac 2016  Cahors

Description: A bold, juicy wine with black fruits and generous tannins, this is developing well, although it's certainly not ready. Blackberry fruit is shot through with juiciness that is still bright and very up front. The wine needs some time, so drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2017 Atrium  (Cahors)

Description: This ancient estate has produced a richly structured wine. Still young, its juicy acidity is developing into the complex, dark tannins. With fruitiness still up front, the wine needs some more time to fill out. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Labastide Haute 2017  Cahors

Description: A selection from the best parcels of the estate, this wine sets out to impress. But its weight, alcohol and density are all too much. It is a body-building wine, solid and concentrated. Still too young the wine is likely to be ready from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Château de Haute-Serre Icône Wow  (Cahors)

Description: This bright-purple-colored wine from selected parcels has no added sulfur. With its gushing berry flavors and soft tannins, it is made to drink young. Attractively fruity, the wine will be ready from early 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Famaey 2018 Cuvée S  (Cahors)

Description: From the stony clay soil of the second terrace above the Lot river, this wine has a firm structure, with plenty of elegant tannins and black fruits. The combination offers a spicy, dry wine that will be best from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Saint-Sernin 2016 de Galets  (Cahors)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: The nose of this wine starts off a bit shy and reserved, with faint notes of pressed violet, black cherry, plum and fudgy brownie. The palate then offers more intense flavors of brambly berry and cherry that are framed by soft, fine tannins and ample acidity to lend a juicy impression through the close.                      Lauren Buzzeo
Name: Rare Vineyards 2018 Malbec (Vin de France)

Description: Produced from organic grapes, this wine revels in pure black-fruit flavors and acidity. Tannins give a dry core to this dense wine. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2017 Tradition  (Cahors)

Description: Aged in wood, with hints of toastiness to go with the smooth black fruits, this wine is balanced and approachable now. Though, acidity and spice are equally important, bringing plenty of aging potential.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Maison Neuve 2018 Elevé en Fût de Chêne  (Cahors)

Description: From the highest terraces above the river Lot, this wine is firm, with some dry tannins. These are balanced by juicy black fruits that shine through the structure, lifted by acidity. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2017 Le Grand Retour  (Cahors)

Description: A ripe and generous wine with soft tannins and swathes of black fruits, this is juicy and spicy. Its structure is fully integrated into the generous fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Tradition Familiale  (Cahors)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Packed rose petals, dark berries, cocoa and earth show on the mellow nose of this bottling. It's pleasant and easy on the palate, with dusty berries, tangy black-plum skin and roasted wood flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Midnight 2016 Solstice Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: This revels in the fruity side of Malbec in Cahors. With attractive acidity along with light tannins, it is made to be drunk now for its easy enjoyment.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos d'Audhuy 2018 Les Polissons  (Cahors)

Description: This easygoing wine is softly textured and full of blackberry flavors. It is ripe, fruity and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2017 Gouleyant  (Cahors)

Description: Ripe, smoky blackberry flavors dominate this perfumed wine. The 18 months in wood have added to the dry core of tannins while leaving room for the juicy fruits. This wine needs to age and soften the tannins. Drink from 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Famaey 2017 Prestige  (Cahors)

Description: For a three-year-old wine this is still structured and dry. Tannins are firm, masking the attractive blackberry fruits. This solid wine will probably retain a dry core.                      Roger Voss
Name: Mas des Etoiles 2016 Petite Etoile  (Cahors)

Description: A soft, spicy wine that shows the brighter side of Malbec, this is packed with black fruits and generous acidity. The core of tannin is just a supporting act, leaving the fruit to shine. Drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Ludovic Laur 2018 3 Lodges Le Pech  (Cahors)

Description: Well balanced and full of ripe black fruits, this wine is made to be drunk young.Spiciness goes easily with the blackberry flavors and a final pinch of pepper. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2017 Pigmentum  (Cahors)

Description: Made from 100% Malbec (or Côt as it is on the label) this wine is soft, with just enough tannins to give shape to the black-currant fruits and acidity. It is perfumed and ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Arbeau 2018 Je Suis à Boire Côt Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Description: This is a young wine, full of easy black-fruit flavors and soft tannins. It shows that Malbec is able to make wines that are fruity and accessible when young. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2018 Hommage à Germain Vigouroux Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Description: Bold and fruity, this wine offers soft tannins and plenty of blackberry flavors. Its dense texture comes from the fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Ponzac 2016 Maintenant ou Jamais  (Cahors)

Description: With tannins still firmly in place, this is also a fruity wine, fresh with acidity. The fruit and the tannins need a few months to come together, so drink from 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Rouffiac 2016 Cuvée Séduction  (Cahors)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fresh and dried herb aromas intermingle with notes of tire rubber, tar and plum. The concentration doesn't seem all there on the palate.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maryhill 2016 Proprietor's Reserve Tudor Hills Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of butterscotch, orange peel and herb are out front. Cherry, plum and orange-peel flavors follow. It doesn't all seem to have fully ripened or be in harmony.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Williamson Vineyard 2016 Malbec

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: This yeasty wine offers red-berry fruits and a tangy, lightly spicy character. It has density as well as plenty of fresh acidity and is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lagrézette 2018 Le Rosé de Julie Malbec (Côtes du Lot)

Description: Ripe and lightly textured, this wine has plenty of red fruits and juicy acidity. It is fresh and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Laur 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Cahors)

Description: This soft, rounded wine is now ready to drink. Black fruits and warm tannins have come together in a ripely structured, juicy, berry-flavored wine. Drink now. Steep Hill Importings and Star Distributors Inc.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vinovalie 2016 L'Infini  (Cahors)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fruity aromas of red currant meet with tangy blackberry balsamic and cracked pepper aromas on the nose of this bottling. It's a bit sour and tangy on the palate, where black-plum and balsamic flavors linger into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sevtap 2016 Malbec (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Bitter tannins mark this wine unfavorably. It is a tough proposition, more tannins than fruit. While it will soften, the tannins will likely remain dominant.                      Roger Voss
Name: Baron la Rose 2017 Malbec  (Bordeaux)

Description: Given that 2015 was a tough year in Mendoza, especially for high-expression reds like this, Apartado is an unbridled success. This is round, ripe and complex on the nose, with exotic aromas of cardamom, spiced blueberry and rubber. The palate feels bold, crisp and bright. Flavors of blackberry, boysenberry and mixed spices drop off little by little on the finish. Drink for years to come; cellar through 2035.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Rutini 2015 Apartado Gran Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy berry aromas include pastry notes, a strong baking-spice component and a welcome level of jammy richness. A fleshy palate sports balance, while handling its size. Flavors of plum and wild berry benefit from a nice application of chocolaty oak, while on the finish this settles on spice, chocolate notes and dryness. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mi Terruño 2014 Mayacaba Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Even in the most challenging vintages (2015), Cobos always produces at least one stellar wine, and this is it. A pitch-black color and ripe extracted aromas of dried cheese, prune, blackberry and char lead to a huge palate with soft tannins and bold acidity. Charred blackberry, coffee and grilled steak flavors end in darkness on the finish. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Cobos 2015 Cobos Chañares Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Blackberry, cassis and plum aromas are muscled up and chocolaty. A flush palate with depth is balanced, while this tastes of blackberry and cassis. A hint of raisin works its way onto the finish, which is ripe and seemingly not fortified by tartaric acidity, hence this loses some steam towards the end. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Salentein 2015 Single Vineyard La Pampa Estate Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Deep, lush blackberry and baked plum aromas announce a ripe Malbec from high elevation. Saturated on the palate with tartaric acid boost, this tastes of fig, prune, blackberry and chocolate. On the finish, these flavors settle nicely and fade out with ease. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Salentein 2015 Single Vineyard San Pablo Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A smooth-smelling nose is packed with heavy black-fruit aromas as well as with spice notes. A strong bolt of tartaric acidity is propping up this Malbec, such that it's showing none of its five years of age. Screechy blackberry, cassis and cherry flavors come with chocolaty oak notes, while on the finish this is sizzling due to its acid level. Drink through 2040.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Terroir Series Finca Ambrosia Single Vineyard Gualtallary
Name: Trapiche 2014 Terroir Series Finca Ambrosia Single Vineyard Gualtallary Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Ripe blackberry aromas border on raisiny but pull back and settle on rich and chocolaty. This is a huge Malbec with a fairly strong current of acidity running through its core that brightens the berry flavors. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: El Tomillo Estate Plot N°1 Single Vineyard
Name: Salentein 2015 El Tomillo Estate Plot N°1 Single Vineyard Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Description: A full nose of cassis and black plum aromas offers an open invitation to an intense palate. More black fruit flavors come with a touch of dark chocolate, while it feels smooth, dense and chewy on the finish. Drink this full-bodied and affordable gem through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Lamadrid 2017 Single Vineyard Reserva Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: A black color and superrich aromas reminiscent of vintage Port announce an ultraripe Malbec that pushes the limits of how ripe is still good. Cheek-to-cheek tannins and pulpy black fruit pump up the palate, which holds blackened and charred cassis, blackberry and mocha flavors. A chocolaty palate remains more rich than complex. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luna De Esperanza 2014 Barrel Fermented Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Grapy aromas of blueberry, cardamom and exotic spices are unusual but appealing and interesting. A heavy grabby palate is tannic and almost seems collapsed, while this tastes of blackberry, coffee and mocha. A rich finish rumbles to its finale with heat and scratchy tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: The Angel Oak Limited Edition Barrel Fermented
Name: SignoSeis 2015 The Angel Oak Limited Edition Barrel Fermented Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Rich, ripe aromas show more prune than freshness. In the mouth, this single-vineyard Malbec is tannic and clampy. Dry, spicy plum and berry flavors settle closer to raisin, while spicy oak props up a long finish with sappy dark-fruit flavors. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Terroir Series Finca Orellana Single Vineyard
Name: Trapiche 2014 Terroir Series Finca Orellana Single Vineyard Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: A black-fruit aroma melds with notes of campfire, chocolate, vanilla and oyster shell. In the mouth, this is decidedly creamy and weighty. A fully oaked flavor profile revolves around milk chocolate and vanilla, while this Malbec is soft on the finish due to light acidity and mild tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2015 Argentino Malbec (Argentina)

Description: Pure blackberry and black-cherry aromas are elevated by a note of exotic Middle Eastern spice. In the mouth, this is firm and tight, with a touch to tartaric bite. Common top-line Malbec flavors of blackberry, cassis, raisin, baking spices and chocolate finish under control. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Chakana 2017 Estate Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Grainy oak and earthy notes are key parts of a nose that revolves around inky berry aromas. A solid palate balances ripeness, weight and acidity, while flavors of dark plum, prune and black currant are steady on a finish that doesn't stray. Drink through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Cameleon Signature Made With Organic Grapes
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2017 Cameleon Signature Made With Organic Grapes Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Ripe black-fruit aromas are supported by smoke and spice notes on the nose. The strong-boned palate is meaty and full, boasting flavors of blackberry, beef jerky and chocolate. This Malbec shows off the intensity and high quality of the 2017 vintage. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Wapisa 2017 San Javier Malbec (Río Negro Valley)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Oak is the protagonist in this ripe and woody Malbec that six years after harvest still feels raw, pulling, fiery and acidic. Wild, gamy plum and berry flavors are spicy and hard, with a barrel-based flavor component that expands on a searingly dry finish. Drink through 2035.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Enrique Foster 2013 Edición Limitada Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Tight plum and berry aromas come with hints of rubber and road tar. A fully extracted palate, with lively acidity, is tight and tough to get into, while this usually impressive Malbec features deep cassis, berry and chocolate flavors prior to a finish where size dissipates and leaves chocolate, berry and mild herbal notes to ponder. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Melipal 2013 Nazarenas Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Jammy blackberry and cassis aromas are ripe and include an exotic note of cardamom. A healthy palate is structured in layers, while the acidity on this Malbec registers on the low side, which brings richness to the fore. Flavors of blackberry, dark plum, baking spices and chocolate are steady on a focused finish. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Decero 2017 Remolinos Vineyard Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: An ultraripe nose is chocolaty and smells of raisin and prune. A bone-dry palate with sucking tannins tastes of prune, coffee and chocolate cake prior to a toasty finish. While you may love (or hate) the richness of this Malbec, its balance and style are questionable.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Rolland 2013 Val de Flores Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Alto Valle del Río Negro, Other, Argentina
Description: Berry and cassis aromas turn more subdued and crisp with airing—something that you should expect from a cool-climate Patagonian Malbec such as this. Loamy berry and plum flavors carry the palate, while it feels fleshy on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Verum 2017 Malbec (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

Description: Aromas of grilled meat, blackened plum and gritty berry fruits are steady while leading to a solid and balanced palate. Berry and plum flavors come with caramel and chocolate notes, while this feels fresh and smacking on a finish topped with chocolaty accents. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Wild Iris 2013 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)
